eng: DP Ruto finally shares event with President Uhuru
luo: Jalup Ker Ruto nobedo e nyasi achiel kod Ker Uhuru bang' kinde malach.

eng: After a lengthy absence from functions presided over by President Uhuru Kenyatta, Deputy President William Ruto has finally showed up for one - the national prayer breakfast'.
luo: Jalup Ker, William Ruto  mosebedo kabare e nyasi mag Ker Uhuru Kenyatta kuom kinde mogwaro ne oriwore kode e Lamo mar Kwayo Kuwe ne Piny.

eng: Ruto is attending the May 27 prayer breakfast event at Parliament Buildings among a host of other national leaders.
luo: Nyasino timore Mei tarik 27 e Od Piny Owacho, kendo Ruto oriwore gi jotelo mag sirkal mamoko kuno.

eng: This is the third time this year the two are attending the same event after the burial of former Cabinet Minister Simeon Nyachae on February 15 and a Cabinet meeting 10 days later.
luo: Ma en kinde mar adek ma jotelo ariyogo obedo e nyasi achiel  higani. Mokwongo ne gin kanyachiel  Februar 15 e iik mar Simeon Nyachae, ma chon ne en achiel kuom Jotend Tij Sirkal, to mar ariyo ne en e chokruok  moro mar  Jotend Tij Sirkal ma ne otim ndalo 10 bang' iikno.

eng: Prayer Organising Committee Co-chair Dan Maanzo on Tuesday while confirming Ruto’s attendance downplayed the frosty relationship between the President and his deputy, adding that the event provided an opportunity for leaders to reconcile.
luo: Chieng' Tich Ariyo, Dan Maanzo, ma  en jakony jakom mar Komiti Machano Lamo, ne olando ni Ruto ne nie nyasino, kata kamano ne oreyo wach ng'ich mosegabedo e kind jotelo ariyogo kowacho ni Lamono ne dhi miyo jotelogo thuolo mar loso weche e kindgi.

eng: “We hope that the prayers will provide a platform for "the leaders to reach out to each other and reconcile,” said the Makueni MP.
luo: Jabunge ma Makueni ne owacho niya: “Wageno ni lamogi biro miyo jotelogi thuolo mar loso winjruok e kindgi.”

eng: On February 5, the DP skipped the ceremony to commemorate the first anniversary of the death of former President Daniel Toroitich arap Moi despite his name being on the programme.
luo: Ruto ne obare e rapar mokwongo mar Ker Daniel Toroitich arap Moi ma ne itimo Februar 5. Ne otimo kamano kata obedo ni ne omiye migawo moro e chenrono.

eng: Their fallout was amplified in the months of March and April when Ruto skipped various Covid-19 addresses by President Kenyatta.
luo: Ruto ne obare ding'eny e dweche mag Mach gi  April kane Ker Kenyatta wuoyo gi oganda e wi wach Korona, kendo mano ne omiyo onenore ayanga ni winjruok e kind jotelo ariyogo ok ber.

eng: On May 4, Ruto skipped the reception of Tanzania’s President Samia Suluhu at State House, Nairobi, with his aides saying he was not invited.
luo: Mei tarik 4, Ruto ne obare kane irwako Ker mar piny Tanzania Samia Suluhu  e Od Piny Owacho, Nairobi, askeche maritoga Ruto ne owacho ni ne ok ogwel Ruto e nyasino.

eng: Emmanuel Tallam, the Communications Director at the DP’s Office, told the media that Ruto followed the televised proceedings from his Karen Residence Office.
luo: Emmanuel Tallam, ma en Jatelo Mochung' ne Weche mag Tudruok  e ofis mar jalup ker, ne onyiso joland weche ni Ruto ne oluwo weche ma ne timore e nyasino ka en e ofise manie dalane ma Karen.

eng: Ruto also skipped this year’s Labour Day celebrations at State House, Nairobi which was attended by Cotu boss Francis Atwoli and Labour Cabinet Secretary Simon Chelugui.
luo: Bende, Ruto ne obare e nyasi mar  Odiechieng Jotich ma higani, ma ne otim e Od Piny Owacho, Nairobi. Jakom mar Cotu  Francis Atwoli kod Jatelo Mochung' ne Jotij Sirkal, Simon Chelugui ne ni e nyasino.

eng: “We honour and celebrate the extraordinary sacrifices that workers, households and enterprises continue to make to advance our country’s transformation agenda amid the devastating surge in the Covid-19 pandemic,” the DP tweeted on May 1.
luo: Ruto ne owacho niya e tweeter: “Wamor kendo wapuoyo ahinya  chiwruok makende ma jotich, joot kod jo ohala osenyiso ka gidhi nyime timo kinda mondo dongruok obed e pinywa kata obedo ni tuwo mar Korona osemedo landore.”

eng: According to the Constitution, Ruto is the principal assistant of the president and should attend all gazetted State functions at which the only speakers are the President, him, the host governor and sometimes Raila.
luo: Kaluwore gi Chik mar Piny,  Ruto e jakony Ker maduong' moloyo ma onego obed kode e nyasi duto mopwodh mag sirkal ma joma wuoyoe gin Ker, Ruto owuon, Gavana ma kanyo kata Raila.

eng: Since March 2018, when President Kenyatta shook hands with ODM leader Raila Odinga, and more so 2020 and 2021, the DP has been isolated in his own government, making him an outsider in decision-making and key meetings.
luo: Nyaka ne Ker Kenyatta Mosre gi jatend ODM  Raila Odinga, Mach 2018, to ahinya ahinya e higni mag  2020 kod 2021 osebed ka idhiro Ruto mabor gi sirkal, ok miye thuolo mar riwruok gi jomoko sama ing'ado weche mag sirkal kata thuolo mar bedo e chokruoge madongo mag sirkal.

eng: He has however attributed this isolation to an attempt by President Kenyatta’s inner circle to lock him out of the Head of State’s 2022 succession plan.
luo: En to owacho ni Ker Kenyatta ema dhire mabor kik oriwre gi jotelo madongo mondo kik obed achiel kuom joma chung' mondo okaw telo mar ker e higa mar 2022.

eng: “If President Kenyatta now trusts other people and consults more with Raila, I have taken it with grace. The style changed, and it is the prerogative of the President being the boss,” Ruto said during a recent interview with Citizen TV.
luo: Ruto ne owacho niya e mbaka moro ma ne ogoyo e Citizen TV; “Kapo ni Ker Kenyatta ogeno jomoko moloya, ma koro sani Raila ema oporogo weche, mano ok litna. Weche oselokore e kindwa kode, to mano en yiero mar Ker nikech enie jatelo.”

eng: Today’s event whose theme is a “Hopeful Future” brings together leaders from all the arms of the Government and across the political divide when the country is in the middle of a pandemic.
luo: Wich maduong' ma ne iwuoyoe kawuono ne en, “Wan- gi Geno e Kinde Mabiro.” Wachno omiyo kidienje mopogore mag jotend sirkal  kod josiasa mag pati mopogore opogore oriwore kanyachiel sama  Kenya duto nyagore gi masira mar Korona.

eng: The prayer meeting is being attended both virtually and physically.
luo: Jomoko odonjo e chokruogno e yor intanet to jomoko odhi kuno achiel kachiel.

eng: The event that takes place on the last Thursday of May each year, is hosted by Speakers of the bicameral parliament Justin Muturi and Kenneth Lusaka and Chaired by Senate Majority Leader Samuel Poghisio, co-chaired by Maanzo.
luo: Chokruogno itimoga higa ka higa, Tich Ang'wen mogik  e dwe mar Mei. Chokruogno ochung'ne gi Jotend Od Bura Moriw, Justin Muturi kod  Kenneth Lusaka. Jakom mar Chokruogno en Samuel Poghisio ma en Jatend Joma Thoth e Senet kod jakonyne ma en  Maanzo.

eng: Chief Justice Martha Koome, ANC leader Musalia Mudavadi and Wiper leader Kalonzo Musyoka are also in attendance.
luo: Jatend Jong'ad Bura, Martha Koome, kod jatend ANC Musalia Mudavadi gi Kalonzo Musyoka  ma en jatend Wiper bende ne nie chokruogno.

eng: The NPB was first held in 2003 after former President Mwai Kibaki took office with its primary purpose being to meet, engage, interact and pray for the nation in the company of fellow leaders from all sectors of society.
luo: Lamo mar Kwayo Kuwe ne Piny, ne ohang tim e higa mar 2003 kane Ker Mwai Kibaki okawo telo. Gima duong' ma ne omiyo ochake ne en ni jotelo mopogore opogore orom kanyachiel, giwuo kendo gilam ne piny.

eng: Man seeks court's intervention to clear confusion over three dates of birth
luo: Ng'ato kwayo ni kot okonye nikech otesene nyiso tarige mopogore opogore mag nyuol.

eng: Age is just but a number, the saying goes.
luo: Ngero moro wacho ni hik ng'ato ok en gimoro.

eng: But that is not always true for everyone.
luo: To mano ok en adier kuom ji duto.

eng: One such person is Francis Paul Kerre whose identification documents show three different ages.
luo: Francis Paul Kerre en achiel kuom joma hikgi osechando ka oboke ge mag sirkal  nyiso tarige adek mopogore mag nyuol.

eng: Tired of the tribulations the discrepancies in his age have brought him, Kerre has moved to court to have the matter resolved once and for all.
luo: Gwenyruokno osechande gaming'a, mi koro ool. Omiyo odhi e kot mondo orie wachno dichiel ma ok dogie kendo.

eng: His birth certificate and national ID show he is 70, KRA Pin Certificate 66 and his passport 60 years.
luo: Satifiketne mar nyuol kod kipandene nyiso ni en jahigni 70, KRA Pin Certificate mare to nyiso ni en jahigni 66 to paspot mare nyiso ni en jahigni 60.

eng: Kerre now wants these details aligned to give him a peace of mind and spare him the many questions he sometimes has to answer.
luo: Kerre koro dwaro ni orie wachni dichiel mondo otesego duto onyis tarik achiel mondo obedie gi kuwe ma ok thung'e gi penjo kaka jatimore.

eng: He says an earlier plea to the registrar to rectify the anomaly did not bear fruit.
luo: Kerre wacho ni ne okwongo okwayo rejistra mondo oriene wachno, to rejistra ne ok okonye.

eng: He contends that the person who prepared his birth certificate entered the wrong birth date.
luo: Kerre oramo ni ng'at ma ne ondiko satifiketne mar nyuol ne ondiko tarik ma ok kare.

eng: Court documents read that he has since confirmed the year he was born.
luo: Nonro mag kot nyiso ni gie sani, Kerre oseyango higa ma ne onyuolee.

eng: Kerre says he was born on October 15, 1954.
luo: Kerre wacho ni ne onyuole Oktoba 15, 1954.

eng: This is the date in his KRA Pin certificate, which means he is 66.
luo: Mani e tarik manie Pin satifiket mar KRA, manyiso ni en jahigni 66.

eng: The petitioner avers that the error in the birth certificate was caused by the initial entry in his birth certificate when he was born and he has since confirmed his correct date of birth.
luo: Kerre onyono ni kane onyuole, ne ondik  tarik ma ok kare e satifiketne, kendo ni gie sani  ong'eyo tarik sie ma ne onyuolee.

eng: The petitioner seeks court’s intervention to rectify his birth certificate and have the correct date of birth entered in the register and his birth certificate,” Kerre’s court papers read in part.
luo: Kerre kwayo ni kot okonye rieyo tarik manie satifiketne mar nyuol mi oket tarik makare e rejista,” Mago gin moko kuom weche ma ne Kerre okwayo ni kot otimne.

eng: Teenage pregnancy, early marriages to blame for Ugenya school dropout cases
luo: E piny Ugenya, nyiri mang'eny weyo skul nikech gimako ich kata gidhi tedo chon.

eng: The Ministry of Education has blamed teenage pregnancies and early marriages for rising cases of school dropouts in Ugenya, Siaya County.
luo: Migawo Mochung'ne Somo wacho ni kwan mar nyiri moweyo skul omedore Ugenya, Kaunti ma Siaya,  nikech nyiri mang'eny mako ich kata dhi tedo chon.

eng: County Director of Education Nelson Sifuna said there are also reports of children dropping out of school for bodaboda business while others cross to Uganda through Busia border in search of jobs.
luo: Jatelo Mochung'ne Migawo mar Somo e Kauntino, Nelson Sifuna  wacho ni ripode mamoko ma bende giyudo gin ni nyithindo moko weyo skul mondo giriemb bodaboda to moko ng'ado gi Busia ka gidhi dwaro tich Uganda.

eng: Sifuna urged locals to take advantage of the free primary education programme despite other challenges to ensure all children of school-going age attend school.
luo: Sifuna ne onyiso jo Ugenya ni kata obedo ni gin kod chandruoge mang'eny, gi ti maber gi chenro ma sirkal oketo mar somo maonge chudo e skunde mag praimari. Gine ni nyithindo duto monego obed e skul, dhi e skul kaka dwarore.

eng: "But we also understand that life at home has been difficult especially for the orphans who have to provide for themselves," said Sifuna.
luo: Sifuna ne owacho ni;  "Kata kamano, wang'eyo ni ngima osebedo matek e mier, to ahinya ahinya ngima osebedo matek ne nyithind kiye ma nyaka many chiembgi giwegi."

eng: He said most of those who drop out of school said they did not have uniforms while some said they had to fend for their siblings or themselves.
luo: Sifuna wacho ni ng'eny nyithindo maweyo skul wacho ni giweyo skul nikech gionge yunifom kata ochunogi manyo kaka gichiemo kata  kaka ginyalo pidho nyithindgi mamoko.

eng: Sifuna challenged parents and guardians to monitor school-going children so that they don't engage in negative social activities that could distract them from school.
luo: Sifuna ne ojiwo jonyuol kod joma moko marito nyithindo mondo gine ni  nyithindo ma pod nie skul ok donj e timbe maricho manyalo monogi tieko skul.

eng: “Most of the children also live with their grandparents and you know they are never strict with their grandchildren who get lots of freedom and end up engaging in negative social activities," he said.
luo: Sifuna ne omedo wacho niya; “Ng'eny nyithindo odak gi deye kata kweregi to joma oti jo mbeko tol ahinya ne nyikwagi kendo mano miyo nyithindogo thuolo mar donjo e timbe maricho."

eng: Between 2018 to 2020 about 53 pupils dropped out of school while another 39 students dropped out of Secondary schools in Ugenya sub-county, Siaya County.
luo: E kind higni mag 2018 gi 2020 nyithind praimari 53  gi nyithind sekondari 39 noweyo skul e sab kaunti ma Ugenya, Siaya Kaunti.

eng: Meanwhile, Daniel Odhiambo, a local philanthropist, has donated over 200 school uniforms to needy pupils.
luo: Wach maber ma ne otimore en ni  Daniel Odhiambo, ja Ugenya ma chunye ler kendo mohero konyo ji, ne ochiwo yunifom 200 ne nyithindo ma jochan.

eng: Odhiambo said he made the donation after receiving complaints from local widows and grandmothers taking care of orphans that they could not meet the pupils’ needs because of the tough economic situation in the country.
luo: Odhiambo ne owacho ni otimo kamano nikech ne owinjo ywak mag mond liete kod deye mapidho nyithi kiye. Giwacho ni ok ginyal chopo dwaro mag nyithind skulgo nikech ngima osebedo matek ahinya.

eng: He said some school-going children from needy backgrounds, mostly orphans, have dropped out of school due to lack of school uniform.
luo: Owacho ni moko kuom nyithind skul ma jochan oseweyo skul nikech gionge yunifom.

eng: "Most of them especially girls feel shy when they don’t have uniforms or have torn ones and end up dropping out of school. That is why I sponsored them to stay in school," he said.
luo: Ne omedo wacho niya; "Ng'eny nyithindo ma jochan, to moloyo nyithindo manyiri wigi kuot ka gionge yunifom kata ka yunifom margi oyiech, kendo mano miyo giweyo skul. Omiyo ang'iewonegi yunifom mondo kik giwe skul."

eng: The ministry has now resorted to sensitisation in all forums, use of role models to offer talks to the school-going children.
luo: Migawo mar Somo ong'ado ni gibiroga wuoyo e wi wach nyithindo manyiri weyo skul  sa moro amora ma giyudo thuolo mar wuoyo gi ji  kendo gibiro kwayo jogo ma gin ranyisi mabeyo e oganda mondo ojiw nyithi skul gi twege.

eng: Odhiambo encouraged former students to visit their schools, especially in the villages to help the ministry fight school dropout.
luo: Odhiambo ne okwayo jo ma osetieko skul mondo olim skunde ma ne gisomoe, to moloyo skunde manie gweng' mondo gikony Migawo mar Somo kedo gi wach nyithindo weyo skul.

eng: He lauded the county government for initiating adopt a school programme that has been distributing masks and sanitisers in local schools.
luo: Odhiambo ne opuoyo sirkal mar kaunti kuom chako chenro mar  Konyo Skunde. Ma en program ma osebedo katero masks kod sanitaisa e skunde manie gweng'.

eng: "We have taken advantage of the programme to encourage alumnus to visit their former schools and offer talks," he added.
luo: Ne omedo wacho niya; "Watiyo gi thuolono mondo wakwa ji mondo olim skundegi machon kendo gijiw nyithindo ma somo kuno gi twege."

eng: Drama in Migori, widow evicted from land by sister-in-law
luo: Tula muoch Migori, sama nyamin dichwo riembo chi owadgi ma chi liel  e dala.

eng: Standing on her husband’s grave, Felister Wabwire wails uncontrollably as police officers plead with her to leave.
luo: Felister Wabwire ne ochung' e liend chwore kogoyo nduru malit sama polise ne temo saye mondo owuog e dala.

eng: The police are here to execute an eviction order on the widow from the land she claims was bought by her late husband, Fedelis Wabwire, in Oruba Keyo Village, Migori County, 25 years ago.
luo: Kot ne ooro polisego mondo gidhi gigol Felister e lowono. Miyono to  wacho ni chwore, Fedelis Wabwire, mawuok e Gweng' ma  Oruba Keyo, Migori Kaunti, ne ong'iewo lowono higni 25 mokalo.

eng: The eviction followed Senior Principal Magistrate Johnstone Munguti's order obtained by the widow’s sister-in-law, Nekesa Mukhongo.
luo: Jang'ad Bura Maduong' Johnstone Munguti e ma ne ogolo chik ma ne omiyo Nekesa Mukhongo, nyamin dichwo ma ne osethono, ratiro mar riembo chi liel.

eng: Nekesa claims the land belongs to her and that her mother and two brothers were buried on it.
luo: Nekesa wacho ni mano en lope, kendo ni min-gi kod owetene ariyo ne oik kanyo.

eng: “I have stayed here for over 25 years and gave birth to four children with my late husband who died three years ago,” Felister said.
luo: Felister to wacho niya; “Asedak e lobni kuom higni mokalo 25 years kendo asenyuolo nyithindo ang'wen kae gi jaoda ma ne otho higni adek mokalo."

eng: She said it was one year ago when her sister-in-law, Nekesa, together with her husband came and claimed they owned the land.
luo: Felister wacho ni en higa achiel nyaka ne Nekesa odhi ire kaachiel gi chwore kendo nyise ni lowono en margi.

eng: “I don’t know where to go with my children and I am requesting the government to come to my aid,” she said.
luo: Felister ywak niya; “Akiya kama anaterie nyithinda, omiyo akwayo sirkal mondo okonya."

eng: The widow’s son Julius Fedelis Wabwire said her mother and the entire family were evicted from the land by police officers in the morning and had nowhere to go.
luo: Julius Fedelis Wabwire, wuod Felister, wacho ni kawuono gokinyi polise ne ogolo joodgi duto e lowono kendo gionge kama ginyalo dhiye.

eng: But Nekesa told The Standard Felistas had separated with her late husband and only came back after he died and took over the land.
luo: Nekesa ne owacho ne jo Standard ni Felistas ne osegawere gi chwore kendo  ni ne oduogo mana ka chwore osetho kae to okawo lowono.

eng: My brother’s wife was convinced by her children to come back to her home and continue settling here.
luo: Nyithindo ema ne owacho ne chi owadwa mondo obi odag kae, kama yande chwore odakie.

eng: It’s me together with my husband who bought the land for my late mother, the land belongs to me,” she said.
luo: An  kaachiel gi chwora ema ne wang'iewo ne minwa lowoni, lopni en mara.

eng: In the ruling in which the eviction order is said to have been issued, the court noted that Felistas had no Kenyan identification papers and directed police to investigate her nationality.
luo: Sama kot ne ong'ado ni ogol Felista e lowono, kot ne owacho bende ni Felista onge gi kipande kata gimoro amora manyiso ni en ja Kenya, kendo kot ne onyiso polise mondo onon ni Felista en japiny mane.

eng: Three fishermen arrested after death of colleague in Lake Victoria
luo: Omak jolupo adek bang' tho mar nyawadgi e Nam Viktoria

eng: hree fishermen have been arrested in Homa Bay County in connection with the death of their colleague.
luo: Ne omak jolupo adek e Kaunti mar  Homa Bay nikech tho mar nyawadgi.

eng: The fishermen who hail from Wadiang’a beach in Suba sub-county were arrested Monday morning and detained at Sindo police post.
luo: Jolupogo wuok  e wath mar Wadiang’a  e sab-kaunti ma Suba. Ne omakgi Wuok Tich gokinyi motergi e polis stesen ma Sindo.

eng: Dancun Omondi alias Nelly met his death on Saturday night while in the company of his colleagues who were on a fishing expedition.
luo: Dancun Omondi ma bende idendo ni Nelly ne otho Jumamos gotieno ka olupo  gi jowetene e nam.

eng: The four fishermen had left Wadiang’a beach and went fishing near Takawiri Island in the neighboring Suba North sub-county.
luo: Jolupo ang'wen-go ne owuok e wath mar Wadiang’a  mi gidhi lupo machiegni gi chula ma Takawiri ma gigoyogo tong' e sab-kaunti ma Suba North.

eng: According to the Secretary of Wadiang’a Beach Management Unit Collins Ochieng’, Omondi disagreed with one of the three fishermen and ended up fighting.
luo: Kaluwore gi Collins Ochieng’ ma en  Jatelo mar Wadiang’a Beach Management Unit, Omondi ne ogwandore gi achiel kuom jolupogo mi gigore.

eng: “The fishermen said Omondi slipped into the lake while exchanging blows with the colleague,” said Ochieng’, adding that the fishermen went into the lake when they were drunk.
luo: Omedo ni “Jolupogo wacho ni Omondi ne okier molwar e nam sama ne gigore gi nyawadgi," Ochieng' wacho ni jolupogo duto ne oyudo osemer sama ne gidhi e nam.

eng: “I think they were acting under the influence of alcohol which is rampant in our beaches,” Ochieng’ said.
luo: Ochieng' medo wacho niya; “Aparo ni ne giyware kamano nikech ne gimer giduto. Kong'o ng'eny ahinya e dho wethewa."

eng: Omondi’s body is yet to be retrieved.
luo: Pok oyud ringre mar Omondi nyaka chop sani.

eng: Suba Sub-county Police Commander Antony Njeru said the three men have been detained as police probe the matter.
luo: Antony Njeru, ma en Polis Kamanda ma Suba Sab-kaunti  wacho ni gimako ji adekgo e sel sama polis pod dhi nyime nono wachno.

eng: “We don’t know whether they killed him and dumped his body in the lake or the fisherman drowned after slipping from the boat as they say,” Njeru said.
luo: Njeru wacho niya; “Ok wang'eyo kata ne ginege mi giwito ringrene e nam, kata giwacho adier ni ne okier molwar e nam mi pi otere.

eng: Njeru said he will hand the suspects to his colleagues in the Mbita Sub-county where the incident occurred.
luo: Njeru wacho ni obiro tero jolupo adekgo e sab- kaunti ma Mbita kama wachno ne otimoree.

eng: Man in trouble for defiling teenage girls in his house
luo: Wach omako dichwo moro nikech osebedo ka oterore gi nyiri ma nyithi skul

eng: Security officers in Homa Bay County have rescued two schoolgirls from a man who allegedly has been defiling them for the last month.
luo: Polise ma Kaunti ma Homa Bay oreso nyithi skul ariyo e lwet jal moro mosebedo ka terore kodgi kuom dwe achiel.

eng: The 15-year-old girls were rescued from a house at Kadongo trading center, Kowidi Sub-location in Rachuonyo East Sub-county on Saturday.
luo: Nyithindo ma nyirigo ma johigni 15 ne ogol e ot moro  Jumamos e senta ma Kadongo, e Sab - lokason ma Kowidi man e Sab-kaunti ma  Rachuonyo East.

eng: The minors hail from Nyakach sub-county and disappeared from their homes a month ago.
luo: Nyithindogo wuok e sab-kaunti ma Nyakach, kendo giselal kuom dwe achiel.

eng: One of the girls sat her 2020 Kenya Certificate of Primary Education (KCSE) and got 288 marks at a primary school in Kisumu County and another one is a Standard Seven pupil.
luo: Achiel kuom nyirigo ne otimo penj mar (KCSE) Kenya Certificate of Primary Education higa mokalo, 2020 e praimari skul moro e kaunti ma Kisumu  moyudo maks 288. Nyako machielo to  jaklas abiriyo.

eng: The children were found in a carpenter's house and were identified by a Nyakach resident who had gone to Kadongo, who then informed family members.
luo: Ne oyud nyithindogo e od ja goranda moro. Ja Nyakach moro ma ne oyudo odhi Kadongo ne ong'eyo nyithindogo mi otero wach ne joodgi.

eng: Kowidi assistant chief Michael Aoro rushed to the scene and rescued the minors.
luo: Asistant chif ma Kowidi, Michael Aoro, ne odhi e odno mapiyo mokawo nyithindogo.

eng: “The incident is strange because the man has been defiling the girls in his house. One of them is telling us that she used to sleep in a chair while the other was sleeping in the man's bed,” Aoro said.
luo: Aoro wacho ni; “Wachni kore tek nikech ng'atni osebedo ka terore gi nyithindogi kuom kinde. Achiel kuom nyirigi wacho ni onindoga e kom to nyawadgi nindo e otando mar dichwono."

eng: "But her statement does not make sense because she is not telling us the reason why she left home and resorted to sleeping in a chair inside a house that doesn’t belong to her relative,” he added.
luo: Aoro medo niya: "Gima nyathini wacho ok donj maber, nikech ok onyiswa gimomiyo ne owuok dalagi mondo onind e kom mar ng'at ma ok en kata watne."

eng: The administrator took the minors to Othoro Police Station where police interrogated them further before they underwent medical tests at Othoro Hospital.
luo: Aoro ne otero nyithindogo e Polis Stesen kama polis ne openjogi weche momedore kae to bang'e ne otergi e osiptal ma Othoro mondo opimgi.

eng: Police are still looking for the man who escaped during the raid.
luo: Polise pod manyo dichwogno nikech ne oringo sama ne odhi kaw nyithindogo.

eng: “The man disappeared after realising that the minors’ family members were in his house,” Aoro said, adding that they will ensure he is arrested.
luo: Aoro wacho ni; “Dichwono ne oringo kane ofwenyo ni wede nyithindogo nie ode." Kata kamano, ne omedo wacho ni gibiro neno ni omake.

eng: He urged parents to take care of their children to prevent such incidents.
luo: Ne owacho ne jonyuol mondo orit nyithindgi mondo gik ma kamago kik timre.

eng: Let parents be keen in monitoring movements of their children to enhance their safety.
luo: Jonyuol onego onon ahinya kuonde ma nyithindgi wuothoe mondo gigeng'negi chandruok.

eng: Defilement is a serious offence,” he added.
luo: Ne omedo niya; "Terruok gi nyathi en ketho maduong' e nyim sirkal."

eng: Magoha challenges Homa Bay-based varsity to prioritise fish production
luo: Magoha nyiso yunivasiti man Homa Bay ni giket motelo wach pidho rech.

eng: Education Cabinet Secretary Prof George Magoha has told Tom Mboya University College management to prioritise research on fish production and how to end perennial water shortage in Homa Bay County.
luo: Jatelo mochung' ne Somo, Profesa George Magoha owacho ne joma ochung'ne Tom Mboya University College mondo giket motelo timo nonro mar pidho rech kod kaka inyalo tiek nok mosiko mar pi e Kaunti ma Homa Bay.

eng: The university which is the first higher learning institution in the county was opened in Homa Bay town in 2016.
luo: Ma e yunivasiti mokwongo mochak e kaunti mar Homa Bay. Noyawe e taon ma Homa Bay e higa mar 2016.

eng: It currently operates as a constituent college of Maseno University.
luo: Gie sani, en e bwo Yunivasiti ma Maseno.

eng: Prof Magoha, who was accompanied by Homa Bay Deputy County Commissioner Jude Wasonga, Homa Bay County Director of Education Fredrick Kiiru, Maseno University Vice-Chancellor Prof Julius Nyabundi and Tom Mboya Principal Prof Charles Ochola, said the purpose of a university is to undertake research for ending problems facing the society.
luo: Profesa Magoha ne owacho ni gima duong' ma yunivasiti onego otim en timo nonro kaka inyalo tiek chandruoge manie alwora. Profesa Magoha ne ni kanyachiel  gi Jude Wasonga ma en Jalup Kaunti Komisona ma  Homa Bay, Fredrick Kiiru, ma en Jatelo Mochung'ne Migawo mar Somo e Kaunti ma Homa Bay, Prof Julius Nyabundi, jatelo ma  Maseno University kod Profesa Charles Ochola motelo ne Tom Mboya Yunivasiti.

eng: “Homa Bay County is known for water shortage but the work of a university is to solve societal problems.
luo: Profesa Magoha ne owacho niya: “Nok mar pi e Kaunti mar Homa Bay en gima ong'ere to tich maduong' mar yunivasiti en loyo chandruoge manie alwora.

eng: Let this university focus on water and do research which can end water shortage in Homa Bay,” said Prof Magoha.
luo: Yunivasitini onego ochomre rando gi wach pi kendo gitim nonro e kaka inyalo tiek nok mar pi e Kaunti ma Homa Bay.

eng: Magoha who spoke on Friday when he supervised the construction of a Sh300 million storey building that will be used for classes and laboratories in the university, said the young university can survive well if it focuses on fish production.
luo: Magoha ne owuoyo kuno Tich Abich kane odhi nono kaka igero gorofa ma dhikawo milion 300. Gorofano dhi ting'o klase kod laboratori. Ne owacho ni yunivasiti mapod nyienno biro dhi maber ka po ni giketo pachgi e pidho rech.

eng: He argued that the community in which the university operates recognises fish as their best diet hence investing in research aimed at producing fish will make it prosper.
luo: Ne owacho ni ji e alwora mar yunivasitino ogeno rech kaka chiemo maberie moloyo, omiyo ka yunivasitino oketo kinda e nonro mar pidho rech, yunivasitino biro dhi maber.

eng: I am impressed by the infrastructural development going on in this university.
luo: Amor ahinya gi gedo ma dhi nyime e yunivasitini.

eng: “However, it must invest in research on fish production for it to survive,” he added.
luo: Ne omedo niya; “Kata kamano, mondo yunivasitini ochung' maber, nyaka utim kinda a hinya e nonro mar pidho rech.”

eng: The CS said the university has the capability to be the chief producer of fish in Homa Bay County as part of both academic and economic development.
luo: Jatelono ne owacho ni yunivasitino nyalo pidho rech mang'eny moloyo kamoro amora e Kaunti mar Homabay duto, kendo pidho rech nyalo kelonegi dongruok e yore mag somo kod yore mag yuto.

eng: “We don’t expect lecturers of this university to depend on fish got from elsewhere. Focus on fish production too,” Magoha said.
luo: Magoha ne owacho niya: “Jopuonj mag yunivasitini ok onego omany rech oko. Un bende pidhuru rech!"

eng: Tom Mboya is currently undertaking a number of infrastructural development projects to enable it to acquire a charter so that it becomes a fully-fledged university.
luo: Yunivasiti ma Tom Mboya gero ute mopogore opogre mondo gin bende sirkal omigi ratiro mar bedo yunivasiti mochung' kende.

eng: However, it has not been established when it will acquire the charter.
luo: "Kata kamano, pok ong'ere ni ibiro migi ratirono karang'o. "

eng: It has 3000 students pursuing various courses.
luo: En gi jopuonjre 3000 matiegore e lony mopogore opogore.

eng: The university started with agriculture, business and education courses.
luo: "Yunivasitino ne ochako gi tiego ji e lony mar pur, lony mar ohala kod lony mar puonj."

eng: The university was built at the Homa Bay Farmers Training Centre (FTC) which used to train farmers on good farming practices.
luo: Ne oger yunivasitino Homa Bay Farmers Training Centre (FTC), kama ne itiegoga jopur e yore  mag pur.

eng: Employment court reinstates impeached official until case is determined
luo: Kot mar jotich odwoko e tich jal moro ma yande oriemb e tich. Giwacho ni oti nyaka chop kama kot ong'adone bura.

eng: The High Court has granted reprieve to impeached Homa Bay County Health executive Prof Richard Muga.
luo: Kot ma Malo, omiyo Profesa Richard Muga ma yande odonjne thuolo matin mar yweyo. Profesa Muga en Jatelo e Migawo mar Thieth e Kaunti ma Homabay.

eng: Prof Muga was impeached by Homa Bay MCAs on May 12 over alleged abuse of office and gross violation of the Constitution.
luo: Jo Od Bura mag Homabay(MCAs) ne odonjone Profesa Muga  Mei, tarik 12. Ne gidonjone ni otiyo marach gi migawone kaka jatij sirkal kendo oketho chik e okang' malach.

eng: County Assembly Deputy Speaker Ellyas Orondo tabled a motion that led to impeachment of the Health executive.
luo: Ellyas Orondo ma en jalup Jatend Od Bura e Kaunti ne otero  wach ma ne omiyo odonjne jatelono.

eng: Muga later filed a petition at the Employment and Labour Relations Court in Kisumu challenging the MCAs’ action that was intended to remove him from office.
luo: Bang'e, Muga ne otero kesneno ne  Employment and Labour Relations Court man Kisumu ka otamore wach  Jo Od Bura ma ne dwaro gole e tich.

eng: In the case, Muga sued Homa Bay County Assembly and Governor Cyprian Awiti.
luo: "E kesneno, Muga ne odonjone Od Bura ma Homa Bay kod Gavana Cyprian Awiti."

eng: Justice Stephen Radido yesterday ruled that Muga should continue serving as Health executive until the case is heard and determined.
luo: Stephen Radido, ma en Jang'ad bura, nyoro ong'ado ni Muga odhi nyime tiyo kaka jatelo e migawo mar Thieth nyaka chop kinde ma ing'adoe kesne.

eng: “This court grants conservatory orders staying the whole of the respondent’s action of removing the petitioner from the position of CECM for health pending hearing and determination of the application and petition filed,” Justice Radido ordered.
luo: Jang'ad Bura Radido ne ochiko niya:“Kotni ochiko ni kik tim kaka joma odonjone Muga dwaro. Kik gol Muga e tije mar CECM mar Thieth nyaka chop kama owinj kesne e kot kendo ongadne bura.”

eng: The County Assembly and Awiti were directed to file and serve their submissions before August 5.
luo: Ne owach ne  Od Bura ma Kaunti kod Awiti mondo giter otese ma gidonjonego Profesa Muga e kot kapok ochopo tarik 5, Agost.

eng: Muga was also told to file and serve any further affidavit together with submissions on or before June 21. The judgement will be delivered on October 27.
luo: Muga bende ne onyis ni oter afidavit moro amora ma dobedgo kaachiel gi otese mag kesne Jun tarik 21 kata motelo ne mano. Ibiro ng'ad burano Oktoba tarik, 27.

eng: Girl, 17, disappears in puzzling circumstances on first day of Term 3
luo: Nyako ma jahigni 17, olal odiechieng' mokwongo mar Tam mar 3

eng: A17-year-old girl from Oyugis in Homa Bay County has disappeared from home in unclear circumstances.
luo: Nyako ma jahigni 17  ma wuok Oyugis e Kaunti ma Homa Bay, olal e yo ma omako dhog ji.

eng: Eunice Awino, a student of Atemo Mixed Secondary School, vanished from home on May 10; the first day of Term Three studies in the adjusted 2020 academic calendar.
luo: Eunice Awino, masomo Atemo Mixed Secondary School, ne owuok dalagi Mei, tarik 10. Mano ne en odiechieng' mokwongo mar tam mar adek e higa mar 2020, mikwanoe tam mopogore.

eng: On the said-date, the teenager’s mother, Rael Akinyi, says she went to her bedroom at 6am, and found Awino still asleep.
luo: Rael Akinyi, ma en min Awino, wacho ni chieng'no ne odhi e od nindo mar Awino gimoro sa 12 mokinyi to oyudo ka Awino pod nindo.

eng: Waking up late was uncharacteristic of the teenager, the mother said.
luo: Owacho ni nyakono ok chiewga modeko chieng' skul.

eng: Her school is quite far from where we stay.
luo: Skul modhiga bor gi kama wadakie.

eng: “On normal days, she usually leaves earlier than 6am,” Akinyi told The Standard.
luo: Akinyi ne owacho ne The Standard niya: "Ndalo skul Awino jawuokga e ot kapok sa 12 oromo."

eng: When she asked the teenager why she hadn’t left for school yet, Awino allegedly told her she hadn’t shaved her head, and she would, therefore, be ordered to return home upon reporting to school.
luo: "Kane openjo Awino gimomiyo pok ne odhi e skul, Awino ne owacho ni pok ne olielo wiye, to ka odhi e skul ibiro mana loke ni odog dala."

eng: “She further said that no serious learning takes place on Day One of school resumption,” said Akinyi.
luo: Akinyi ne omedo ni Awino ne owacho ni; "Onge somo malong'o ma dhiga nyime e Chieng' Yepo."

eng: The distressed mother said she, consequently, allowed the girl to stay home as she (Awino) prepared to report to school the following day; May 11.
luo: Miyo ma koro kibach nego ne owacho ni ne oyiene Awino bet dala ka ong'eyo ni oikore dhi e skul chieng' maluwe ma ne en Mei tarik 11.

eng: Akinyi, thereafter, left for Oyugis Town, where she was scheduled to meet a staffer attached to the registration of births office so that she could process Awino’s birth certificate, ahead of KCSE exam enrolment.
luo: "Bang' mano, Akinyi, ne odhi e taon mar Oyugis kama ne owinjore odhi orom gi achiel kuom joma tiyo e ofis mar sirkal mikanoe rijista mar nyuol, mondo olosne barup nyuol mar Awino ma ne idhi tigo mondo okete obed achiel kuom joma dhi timo penj mar KCSE."

eng: When the mother-of-ten returned home in the afternoon, her daughter, who is the lastborn, was not around.
luo: "Kane Akinyi oduogo dala, Awino ma en choke kuom nyithinde apar, ne onge."

eng: Her school bag was also missing.
luo: Bagne mar skul bende ne onge.

eng: Her books, however, had been stashed in a sack and placed at a corner in the living room.
luo: Kata kamano, bugene ne oso e gunia moket e kona moro kor budho.

eng: The money Akinyi had left Awino for food was still on a stool, the girl’s mother said.
luo: Miyono wacho ni pesa ma ne oweyo ne Akinyi mondo ong'iewgo chiemo ne pod nie stul.

eng: Neighbours told Akinyi that they saw the teenager leaving home on a boda boda at noon on May 10.
luo: Jirende ne owacho ne Akinyi ni ne gineno Awino kawuok dala e boda boda gimoro sa auchiel modiechieng' Mei tarik 10.

eng: “I, immediately, inquired from all my relatives who live nearby whether Awino had visited them, but they responded in the negation,” said Akinyi.
luo: “Akinyi wacho ni kanyo gikanyo ne ochako penjo wedegi duto ma odak machiegni kabe Awino ne olimogi, to ne ginyise ni ooyo."

eng: Later that day, at around 9pm, Awino called her mother using an anonymous contact, and informed her that she was housed by a middle-aged woman in Kisii, and that Akinyi shouldn’t worry about her.
luo: Bang'e chieng'no, gimoro saa adek motieno, Awino ne ogoche ne min mare gi namba moro ma ok ong'ere konyise ni en e od miyo moro Kisii, omiyo min-gi kik bed gi kibach.

eng: The distraught parent reported the happenings to her daughter’s school the following day before filing a missing person’s report at Oriwo Police Station.
luo: Miyono ma koro chunye chandore ne otero wachno e skul ma nyare somoe kae to odhi goyo ripot ni nyathine olal e Polis Stesen ma Oriwo.

eng: Almost two weeks later, Awino is yet to be found.
luo: Jumbe ariyo koro osekalo to pok one Awino.

eng: “The only thing I know is that she was last spotted in Nyamira Market. My attempts to trace her have been futile. I hope we find her safe.”
luo: Akinyi wacho niya: “Wach ma ne awinjo mogik en ni ne onene e Chiro ma Nyamira. Asetemo manye to pok ayude. Ageno ni ongima kama entie.”

eng: Atemo Mixed Secondary School principal, Philip Ayoo, confirmed to The Standard that the minor is a student at the institution.
luo: Philip Ayoo, ma en japuonj maduong' Atemo Mixed Secondary School ne owacho ne The Standard ni rawerano en japuonjre e skundno.

eng: She (Awino) has never had any disciplinary problems.
luo: Owacho ni Awino ne en nyako modimbre, mawinjo wach kendo pok nochendoga e skul.

eng: We are shocked to learn that she went missing from home,” said Ayoo.
luo: Ayoo wacho niya: "Wabwok winjo ni oringo owuok dala.”

eng: Rusana's candidature causes political heat as race to succeed Obado intensifies
luo: Wach chung' mar Rusana kelo ywarruok mang'eny ahinya mag siasa sama  ng'wech milaroe kom Obado chopo e akere keke.

eng: he entry of Migori County Secretary into the race to succeed Governor Okoth Obado appears to have rattled seasoned politicians who have accused him of using elders to endorse his candidature.
luo: Josiasa machon ok mor ni Rusana ma en Jatelo mar Kaunti ma Migori odonjo e ng'wech milaroe kom mar  Gavana Okoth Obado. Giwacho ni odonjo e ng'wejno apiny piny kuom wuoyo gi jodongo mondo oyiere.

eng: Christopher Rusana's endorsement by Suba Community elders has seen other aspirants cry foul, saying the decision of the elders who attended the May 3, meeting in Kisii was compromised.
luo: "E chokruok moro ma ne otim Kisii, Mei tarik 3, jodongo mag  Suba ne oyiero Christopher Rusana mondo ema  okaw kom mar Obado. Kata kamano, wachore ni chokruogno ne ok otim e yo malong'o."

eng: The aspirants led by Migori Woman Rep Pamela Odhiambo have vowed never to step down.
luo: Joma moko ma bende laro komno, ne owacho ni ok gibi wuok e ng'wejno ng'ang'. Ne otelnegi gi Pamela Odhiambo, ma en Migori Women Rep  matiende ni Miyo mochung' ne Mine ma  Kaunti ma Migori.

eng: Odhiambo, businessman Philip Mwabe, former Migori MP John Pesa, former Mombasa executive Seth Odongo and businessman Owiso Ngao have rubbished the endorsement, saying the process was unfair and that the outcome was influenced.
luo: Pamela Odhiambo, Philip Mwabe ma  ja ohala , John Pesa ma jabunge machon ma Migori, Seth Odongo, ma yande omako tich maduong' Mombasa kod Owiso Ngao ma bende ja ohala wacho ni wach mar ni jodongo oyiero Rusana mondo ema ochung' en gima ok ginyal tiyogo nikech yierono ne olengore konchiel kendo ne ok otime kaka owinjore.

eng: The exercise was conducted by elders led by Pentecostal Evangelical Faith of Africa (PEFA) chairman John Okinda and a team of six opinion leaders from Suna East and Suna West constituencies.
luo: Yierono ne otim gi jodongo ma ne itayo gi John Okinda ma en jakom mar PEFA kata Pentecostal Evangelical Faith of Africa kod jodongo auchiel mowouk e konstichwensi mag Suna East kod Suna West.

eng: The meeting held at the Carmel Park hotel in Kisii town was attended by Mrs Odhiambo, Rusana, Mwabe and Pesa while Odongo and Ngao did not attend.
luo: "Chokruokno ne otimore Carmel Park hotel, e taon ma Kisii. Joma ne nie chokruokno ne gin Mrs Odhiambo, Rusana, Mwabe kod Pesa. Odongo kod Ngao ne onge."

eng: Speaking to The Standard early this week, Mwabe said he opposed the voting idea after the candidates present refused to pick insisting that despite the selection of Rusana, he would be on the ballot.
luo: "E chak jumani, Mwabe ne owacho ne The Standard ni ne ok oriwo lwedo wach goyo kura nikech joma nie ng'wejno notamore yiero ng'at achiel machung'. Oramo ni kata obedo ni ne oyier Rusana, en  pod obiro chung'."

eng: When contacted by The Standard, Pesa and Mrs Odhiambo said they are still in the race.
luo: "Kane The Standard, owuoyo gi Pesa kod Mrs Odhiambo, ji ariyogo ne owacho ni gin e ng'wech mar laro kom Obado."

eng: “My candidature is not on reverse gear. I will be on the ballot come 2022,” said Mrs Odhiambo.
luo: Mrs Odhiambo ne owacho niya: "Pok aloko pacha kata matin. Abiro chung' e higa mar 2022."

eng: Rusana has, however, downplayed the wrangles, promising to consult with his opponents to ensure the region produces a candidate.
luo: "Kata kamano, Rusana reyo areya ywarruok manie kindgino, owacho ni obiro wuoyo gi jowetenego kendo obiro neno ni ng'ato achiel ema ochung'."

eng: In a phone interview with The Standard on May 16, Rusana who wants to run on an ODM ticket wondered why the change of heart yet his opponents fully participated in the exercise.
luo: "Mei tarik 16, kane The Standard wuoyo e simu gi Rusana madwaro chung' gi otiko mar ODM, jalno ne owacho ni owuoro gimomiyo jowetene ne oloko pachgi to ne gin e chokruogno kendo ne giriwo lwedo yierono."

eng: “We were all present, and they fully participated, I still don’t know what happened a few days later, maybe the media can find out from them,” he said.
luo: "“Rusana wacho niya: Ne wan e chokruogno waduto, kendo ne wariwo lwedo gik moko duto ma ne timore. Pod ok ang'eyo gima ne otimore ndalo manok bang'e. Jofwamb weche nyalo penjogi."

eng: He said with the elders’ blessing, it is all system go as he tries to consolidate his backyard before he can approach other regions.
luo: "Ne owacho ni nikech koro jodongo riwe lwedo, en ng'wech ma ok ong'i chien. Odwaro riwo jothurgi mondo obed  achiel, kae to ochak manyo ombul kuonde mamoko."

eng: The country secretary said he is banking on the support of the masses and not that of Governor Obado as his opponents are claiming to win the seat come 2022.
luo: Jatelono wacho ni ogeno ni raia biro goyone ombul, ok ogeno ni  Gavana Obado biro sire, nimar joma piem kode wacho ni gibiro kawo komno e higa mar 2022.

eng: “There is something the elders saw in me, I don’t take it for granted and will not disappoint their trust,” added Rusana.
luo: Rusana medo niya: "Nitie gima jodongogo ne oneno kuoma. Ang'eyo ni gigena, kendo abiro tiyo kaka dwarore. Ok gibi ywago ang'e ni ne giyiera."

eng: “Because I am always a quiet person, my opponents have been underestimating me. I will not mind getting the support of like-minded leaders who will help me shape Migori, I will first take my mandate to people.”
luo: “Nikech ajaling', jowetena ma walarogo kom osebedo ka ochaya. An to aikora tiyo kanyachiel gi jotelo ma waparogo machal kendo mabiro konya kelo dongruok Migori. Kata kamano, nyaka akwong nyiso jo Migori chenro ma an go.”

eng: According to the Suba community elders led by chairman Riogi Riogi, having a single candidate would increase their son or daughter’s chances of succeeding Governor Obado.
luo: Kaluwore Riogi Riogi,  ma en jakom mar jodong Suba, jodongogo neno ni bedo gi ng'ato achiel machung' e lo jo Suba duto nyalo konyo wuodgi kata nyargi kawo kom mar Gavana Obado.

eng: Riogi said he is aware of the wrangle, but called on other aspirants who felt shortchanged to seek dialogue.
luo: Riogi ne owacho ni ong'eyo ywarruok madhi nyime kata kamano, okwayo joma ng'urgo mondo giwuo kendo giwinjre.

eng: “In our own wisdom, we saw that placing a single candidate would strengthen the community’s unity and supporting the candidate would be easy and hence the winning of the elections,” Riogi said.
luo: "“Riogi ne owacho niya: Kaka jodongo, ne waneno ni en gima riek keto ng'at achiel mondo ema ochung'. Mano miyo Jo Suba bedo achiel kendo riwo  lwedo  ng'at achielno bedo mayot, to mano nyalo miyo wakaw komno."

eng: The Suna clan, which is part of the Suba community, has been angling to field a single candidate to solidify Suna West (46,162 votes) and Suna East (46,574 votes) out of the 389,182 votes in Migori.
luo: Anyuola mar jo  Suna, ma gin oganda mar Suba, osegadwaro ni gibed gi ng'at achiel ma chung' mondo oriw  Suna West ( ma nigi ombulu 46,162) kod Suna East (ma nigi ombulu 46,574) kuom ombulu 389,182 mag Migori duto.

eng: With Governor Obado ditching the ODM for the People’s Democratic Party (PDP) and the Kuria community factor, the 2022 Migori gubernatorial race could be the trickiest.
luo: "Weche dhi twere e ng'wech mar laro kom Gavana e dala mar Migori e higa mar 2022. Nimar Gavana Obada weyo ODM kendo dhi e PDP kata People’s Democratic Party kendo nitiere wach mar oganda jo Kuria."

eng: Obado is reported to have mounted a massive membership recruitment drive for the PDP after announcing he will ditch Raila Odinga-led ODM.
luo: Wachore ni bang' lando ni owuok  ODM mitelone gi  Raila Odinga, Obado osebedo katimo kinda ahinya mar rwako ji mang'eny e pati mar PDP.

eng: The governor's point men have rolled out registration and membership drive across the county manually and digitally in an exercise expected to run up to the end of the year.
luo: Joma tiyo ne gavana wuotho e kauntino duto ka girwako ji e pati mar PDP. Jomoko indiko nyingegi e otas to jomoko irwako nyingegi e kompyuta. En tich ma gibiro timo nyaka giko higani.

eng: Other aspirants who are eying the seat include Assembly Speaker Boaz Okoth, Senator Ochillo Ayacko, former Rongo MP Dalmas Otieno, former Nyatike MP Edick Anyanga, US-based academician Mark Ogutu and businessman Robert Okong’o.
luo: Joma moko mabende dwaro komno gin; Boaz Okoth ma en Jatelo mar Od Bura, Seneta Ochillo Ayacko, Dalmas Otieno ma en Ja bunge machon ma Rongo, Edick Anyanga ma en Jabunge machon ma Nyatike, Mark Ogutu  jasomo man Amerka kod Robert Okong’o ma en ja ohala.

eng: Homa Bay health workers: MCAs interfere with health services
luo: Jothieth ma Homa Bay: Jo Od Bura mag Kaunti donjore gi weche thieth

eng: Health workers’ unions in Homa Bay have accused Members of the County Assembly (MCAs) of interfering with health services at the County Referral Hospital.
luo: Riwruoge mag jo thieth Homa Bay wacho ni jo Od Bura mag Kaunti matiende ni MCAs donjore gi weche thieth e Homa Bay County Referral Hospital.

eng: The County Assembly recently adopted a report that the acting Chief Executive Officer of the hospital Peter Ogolla be removed to pave way for the reinstatement of the former CEO Dr Lilian Kocholla who was recently shown the door.
luo: Jo Od Bura ma Homa Bay nyocha owacho ni  ogol Peter Ogolla e kom mar telo e osiptandno. Peter omako komno nikech nyocha ogol jatelo ma yande nie komno, Dr Lilian Kocholla. Jo Od Bura dwaro ni odwok Dr Lilian Kocholla e migawono.

eng: Dr Kocholla was sent on compulsory leave because of alleged poor management which had put the hospital in a deplorable state.
luo: Ne ochun Dr Kocholla mondo odhi e rusa nikech wachore ni ok oti maber kendo mano omiyo  weche richo ahinya e osiptandno.

eng: This made MCAs through the Health Committee conduct investigations which revealed the hospital lacked many essential drugs including panadol.
luo: Mano ne omiyo Jo Od Bura otimo nonro kokalo kuom Komiti mar Weche Thieth mi giyudo ni osiptandno ne onge yien madwarore ahinya moriwo panadol.

eng: Instead, the MCAs blamed the health executive Prof Richard Muga for the problems in the hospital, before they impeached him a few days later.
luo: Kar keto ketho kama owinjore,  Jo Od Bura ne osiayo ni Profesa Richard Muga  ema okelo chandruogego duto, kae to gidonjone ndalo matin bang'e.

eng: But the Kenya National Union of Nurses (KNUN) and Kenya Union of Clinical Officers (KUCO) accused the MCAs of interfering with the service delivery at the facility.
luo: Kata kamano, riwruoge mag  Kenya National Union of Nurses (KNUN) kod Kenya Union of Clinical Officers (KUCO) ne owacho ni Jo Od Bura donjore gi tije mag osiptandno.

eng: The county KNUN Secretary Omondi Nyonje, KUCO Executive Secretary Philip Mbom and KUCO chairman Stephen Obunga said changes in the management of the hospital should not be altered again.
luo: "Omondi Nyonje ma en jatelo mar KNUN e kaunti , Philip Mbom ma en jatelo mar KUCO kod Stephen Obunga ma en jakom mar KUCO, wacho ni kik chak lok kendo jotelo mag osiptandno."

eng: “It is true that there has been an issue of poor management at the hospital and that is why patients were forced to buy many essential items including gloves for medics to attend to them,” Nyonje said
luo: “Nyonje ne owacho niya: " En adier ni jotend osiptandni ok osebedo katiyo maber emomiyo osechuno jotuwo ng'iewo ne lakteche gik monego obed e osiptal kaka glav mondo laktechego orwak sama ithiedhogi."

eng: He, however, noted that the new management should be given time“ to enable Dr Ogolla to apply all his skills of correcting anomalies which were caused by the previous management.”
luo: "Kata kamano, ne owacho ni jotelo moket manyien onego omi thuolo moromo. Onego omi Dr Ogolla kinde moromo mondo oti gi lony mare kondo orie weche ma ne jotelo machon oketho.”

eng: Mbom argued that the recommendation by the MCAs to reinstate Dr Kocholla is tantamount to interfering with the provision of health services at the hospital.
luo: Mbom ne owacho ni sama Jo Od Bura kwayo ni odwok Dr Kocholla e tich gi donjore gi weche thieth mag osiptandno.

eng: “The change of management was made to correct weaknesses which impeded the proper provision of health services in the hospital. Any attempts to defeat the changes mean impending delivery of health services to Homa Bay residents,” Mbom said.
luo: “Ne omedo wacho ni: " Ne watimo lokruogego mondo walos weche ma ne miyo ji ok yud thieth maber e osiptandni. Sama ng'ato temo geng'o lokruogego, omono Jo Homa Bay yudo thieth mowinjore."

eng: Obunga said health is a sensitive department that should be handled keenly. “We urge MCAs to handle health department with utmost care because any mistake by management of a health facility can cause loss of lives.”
luo: Obunga ne owacho ni weche thieth gin weche ma pek ma ng'ato ok onego omwomoree. " Wakwayo jo Od Bura mondo otang' ahinya nikech sama jotelo mag osiptal oboth e yo moro amora mano nyalo miyo ji olal ngimagi."

eng: The County Assembly Health Committee chairperson Joan Ogada said their aim was to improve service delivery in the hospital.
luo: Joan Ogada ma en Jakom mar  Komiti mar Thieth e Od Bura ma Kaunti wacho ni gin gidwaro mana konyo mondo weche odhi maber e osiptandno.

eng: “The staff at the hospital should forge a spirit of teamwork and unity to ensure quality health service delivery to Homa Bay residents,” Ms Ogada said when she tabled the investigative report in the Assembly.
luo: Sama Ms Ogada ne otero ripot mar nonro ma ne osetim e Od Bura ne owacho ni jotich e osiptandno onego oriwre kendo ginywak ne tich kanyachiel mondo githiedh Jo Homa Bay kaka owinjore.

eng: The fate of Prof Muga now lies in hands of Governor Cyprian Awiti who can decide to sack or retain him in his executive committee.
luo: Gavana Cyprian Awiti ema biro ng'ado gima ibiro timne Profesa Muga. Onyalo ng'ado ni oriembe e tich kata oweye mondo odhi nyime bedo e komiti mochung'ne osiptandno.

eng: Veteran journalist Philip Ochieng was buried at his home in Manyatta Village, Migori County yesterday.
luo: Philip Ochieng, jandiko mang'ula ne oik e dalane e gweng' ma Manyatta, Migori Kaunti.

eng: His family, led by daughter Judith Adhiambo, eulogised him as a family man.
luo: Nyare miluongo ni Judith Adhiambo ne owuoyo e lo joodgi kendo ne owacho ni wuon-gi ne en ng'at mohero joode.

eng: They said he was a celebrity to the outside world, and famous as a wordsmith, but was always quiet at home.
luo: "Giwacho ni ne en rahuma kendo rambaka mabidho dho ingresa ma tamre ginono, kata kamano, kane en e dala, ne en ng'at mamuol kendo ma jaling'."

eng: “It had great meaning for me. My father was never an orator both in public and at home,” said Adhiambo.
luo: Adhiambo medo niya: "Wachno ne berna ahinya. Wuonwa ne en ng'at mopogore e dala, ne ok kel tije e ot."

eng: The family said despite Ochieng’s quiet disposition, he still played with the children, especially his grandchildren.
luo: Joode wacho ni kata obedo ni Ochieng' ne jaling' kamano, ne ojatugo gi nyithinde, to moloyo nyikwaye.

eng: His grandson, Philip Ochieng Junior, said he spoilt them by taking them to parks and buying them candy.
luo: Nyakware miluongo ni Philip Ochieng Junior wacho ni ne oherogi ahinya. Ne ojaterogiga kuonde bayo kendo ong'iewonegi peremende mang'eny mopogore opogore.

eng: “He was a doting grandfather, we were always there and fought to catch his attention and open the door for him when he came home from work,” Junior said.
luo: Junior medo wacho niya: “Ne ohero nyikwaye ahinya, ne walaro yawone dhoot sama oduogo oa e tich."

eng: Editor’s Guild president Churchill Otieno remembered Ochieng as a person who stood out as the father of professional journalism.
luo: Churchill Otieno, ma en  Jatelo mar Editor’s Guild wacho ni Ochieng' ne en jandiko makende, en ema ne opuonjo ji gima ndiko mong'ith en.

eng: “Many appreciate him today for being a mentor. We appreciate him for the courage.
luo: Ji mang'eny ne mor kode nikech ne otiegogi e weche mag ndiko. Wamor ni ne en jachir.

eng: “He built that stage into a global one and his home was no longer Manyatta but the world,” Otieno said.
luo: Otieno ne owacho ni: Ochieng' ne nyalo ndiko adimba e wi gik matimore kamoro amora e piny, ne ok en mana ja Manyatta, ne en thuolo ka moro amora e piny.

eng: He thanked Ochieng’s family and the people of Manyatta village for giving them a great person.
luo: Ne odwoko erokamano ne joodgi Ochieng' kod gweng' ma Manyatta kuom miyogi wuoyi ma wuoyi.

eng: Senator Ochillo Ayacko said the late Ochieng shared knowledge as he prepared people to succeed him in the field of journalism, which he helped shape for six decades.
luo: "Seneta Ochillo Ayacko ne owacho ni Ochieng' ne tiego ji mondo joma biro kawo tich bang'e obed joma olony. Ne okelo lokruoge mabeyo e weche ndiko kuom higni piero auchiel."

eng: “In this village, we will remember him as a great person,” Ayacko said.
luo: "“Ayacko ne owacho ni: "Jogweng'ni nopare kaka ng'at mang'ongo."

eng: According to the family, Ochieng, who spent many years in Nairobi, came back home this year and fell sick after three weeks.
luo: "Joode wacho ni Ochieng' ne odak Nairobi kuom higni mang'eny. Ne odwogo dala higani kae to ochako bedo matuwo mana bang' jumbe adek."

eng: He was taken to St Joseph Ombo Mission Hospital where he died on April 27.
luo: Ne otere St Joseph Ombo Mission Hospital kama ne othoe April tarik 27.

eng: Ochieng was married to Jennifer Dawa with whom they had four children.
luo: Jaod Ochieng' ne en  Jennifer Dawa, kendo ne ginyuolo kode nyithindo ang'wen.

eng: He had another child from an earlier relationship.
luo: Ochieng' ne  onyuolo gi dhako machielo kapok okendo Jennifer.

eng: ODM, UDA protest as police storm Ongwae's home over Bonchari by election
luo: "Polise ne omonjo dala Ongwae nikech yiero mitimo Bonchari, to pati mag ODM, kod UDA okwedo gima ne otimoreno."

eng: Asection of political leaders in Kisii has protested after armed police officers stormed Governor James Ongwae’s home.
luo: Polise momanore gi bunde ne omonjo dala Gavana James Ongwae, kendo moko kuom josiasa ma Kisii oywak ni  gima notimoreno rach.

eng: The politicians allied to ODM and UDA parties said it is unfortunate that police were being used politically to intimidate other leaders ahead of the Bonchari by-election slated for Tuesday next week.
luo: Josiasa mawuok e pati mag ODM kod UDA wacho ni en gima lit ni josiasa moko tiyo gi polise mondo gibwog jowetegi sama ji ochomo yiero matin mar Bonchari mabiro timore Tich Ariyo, juma mabiro.

eng: The two parties have raised concerns over intimidation and harassment by police as their respective candidates conduct campaigns.
luo: Pati ariyogo ywak ni polise chando jopatigi masani timo kampen.

eng: The by-election has attracted 13 contestants.
luo: Ji 13 laro komno.

eng: On Thursday night armed police stormed Kisii County Governor James Ongwae’s residence as he was having tea with Senator Prof Sam Ongeri and Woman Representative Janet Ong’era on accusation that they were holding an illegal political meeting.
luo: Chieng' Tich Ang'wen gotieno, polise ne omonjo dala James Ongwae Gavana ma Kisii. Ne oyudo omadho chae gi  Seneta Profesa Sam Ongeri kod Janet Ong’era Miyo Mochung' ne Mine kata Woman Representative . Polisego ne owacho ni ji adekgo ne timo chokruok mar siasa ma onge rusa.

eng: Addressing the media in Kisii town on Friday morning, Ongwae said he had been informed that an unlawful assembly was taking place at his residence, which they had come to disperse.
luo: Kinyne, Tich Abich gokinyi, ka en Kisii taon,  Ongwae ne owacho ne jofwamb weche ni polise ne owacho ni ne onyisgi ni chokruok ma gwenyore gi chik ne dhi nyime e dalane kendo ne gibiro giriembo ji.

eng: Ongwae said he requested the police to withdraw but they latter insisted they would not leave until the two legislators had left his residence.
luo: Ongwae wacho ni ne okwayo polisego mondo owuog e dalane, kata kamano, ne gitamore ka giwacho ni ok gibi wuok nyaka josiasa ariyogo oa mokwongo.

eng: “I am calling on President Uhuru Kenyatta to put a stop to this, elections come and go. Leaders are all transitory. Democratic institutions must be respected. 50 officers can’t storm my house as if I am a wanted criminal,” he said.
luo: Ongwae ne owacho niya: "Akwayo Ker Uhuru Kenyatta mondo otiek wachni, yiero en gima biro to kalo. Onge jatelo masikoga e kom. Joma oganda oyiero moketo e kom nyaka mi luor. Polise 50 ok nyal mwomore e dalana ka gima an ja mahundu moro ma sirkal manyo."

eng: The governor added: “I didn’t become a governor by accident. I was elected by majority votes. This is not the way to run a Country. I have been a Permanent Secretary and I didn’t see such decisions made. This is unfortunate.”
luo: Ongwae ne omedo niya: “Bedona gavana ok opore apoya. Ne oketa e komni nikech ne ayudo ombulu mang'eny moloyo jomoko. Ma ok en kaka ng'ato onego oloch e wi ji. Ne an jatelo maduong e sirkal to ne ok aneno ka sirkal timo gik ma kamagi. Gik matimoregi richo.”

eng: Senator Ongeri said the party understands the art of winning and losing in any elections.
luo: Seneta Ongeri ne owacho ni patigi ong'eyo gima nyalo miyo giloch e yiero moro kata mi kik giloch.

eng: While urging IEBC to take charge of the forthcoming by-election, Ongeri said he had traversed the Bonchari constituency and was hopeful that the residents will make the right choice.
luo: Ongeri ne okwayo IEBC otim tijgi maber e yiero matin mabiro. Bende, ne owacho ni osewuotho Bonchari duto kendo ogeno ni jo Bonchari biro yiero ng'at mowinjore.

eng: “You may have a temporary relief that you won but I can assure you that you have lost it all. One must understand where people are coming from and where they are going. There are seasons for everything, don't try to maneuver and manipulate the result,” he said.
luo: Ne owacho niya: "Inyalo mor ni ilocho, to  anyalo nyisi gadier ni onge gima iloyo, kendo mornino en mana kuom kinde machuok. Ng'ato nyaka ng'e kama ji owuokie kendo kama ji dhie. Gimoro amora nigi kindene, kik item gwenyo ombulu ma ji osegoyo."

eng: Ong’era in her sentiments said it was shocking for police officers to raid the governor’s residence without a court order.
luo: Ong’era to ne owacho ni en gima mako dhok ni polise nyalo monjo dala gavana ma onge barua mar kot.

eng: “I am demanding concrete reasons from IEBC and other relevant agencies on why they allowed for a by-election yet they know there was Covid-19 amongst us."
luo: “Adwaro ng'eyo gimomiyo IEBC kod riwruoge mamoko oyie ni otim yiero to ging'eyo ni tuwo mar Korona osechopo thurwa."

eng: "We have a by-election in Juja but we have not seen such kind of harassment,” she said.
luo: Ne omedo wacho niya: "Yiero matin dhi nyime Juja to pok wawinjo ni polise chando ji kaka ichandowa koni."

eng: ODM party Secretary General Edwin Sifuna said that "desperate times call for desperate measures."
luo: Edwin Sifuna ma en achiel kuom jotelo e pati mar  ODM  wacho ni "ka weche tek ahinya, okenge mikawo bende medo mana ridore.

eng: Deputy President William Ruto’s quest to infiltrate the Nyanza region ahead of next year’s elections is gaining momentum as his new allies in the region stepped up efforts to popularise him.
luo: Chenro mar jalup Ker William Ruto mar manyo ombulu Nyanza medo mako mach nikech joma yande omakogo osiep kuno timo kinda ahinya mar sunge e alwora mar Nyanza.

eng: The leaders, most of who are considered ODM rebels after falling out with party leader Raila Odinga, are pushing for a generational change in the region’s leadership and a new economic path in their efforts to market the DP.
luo: Ng'eny jotelo mariwo Ruto lwedo ne gin jo ODM mong'anyo bang' gwenyore gi jatend patino Raila Odinga. Gisungo ne ji pati mar DP ka giwacho ni pati mar DP dwaro ni tieng' machielo ema okaw loch Nyanza kendo okel dongruok e alworano.

eng: Last week, leaders who included one of Ruto’s point men in Nyanza, Eliud Owalo, met at a Nairobi hotel to plan what they described as their economic strategy for the region.
luo: Juma mokalo, jotelo moko moriwo Eliud Owalo, ma en achiel kuom joma riwo Ruto lwedo Nyanza, ne oromo e otel moro Nairobi mondo giwuo e wi kaka ginyalo kelo dongruok Nyanza.

eng: They said their strategy will form the basis of their negotiations with other presidential hopefuls ahead of 2022.
luo: Giwacho ni chenro ma gitimo ema gibiro wuoyoe gi joma biro laro kom ker e higa mar 2022.

eng: According to them, anyone seeking the support of the region will have to enter into a pre-election economic pact with them.
luo: Giwacho ni ng'ato ang'ata mabiro dwaro ni Nyanza ogochne, nyaka kwong winjre kodgi kendo oket seyi ni obiro kelo dongruok ma gisendiko pinygo.

eng: This comes as Raila struggles to calm a storm that recently rocked ODM leading to Rarieda MP Otiende Amollo being kicked out of a key parliamentary committee.
luo: Wechegi timore sama Raila koni temo kweyo tula moro ma nyocha omuoch e pati mar ODM. Tulano ne omiyo  ogol Otiende Amollo ma en Jabunge ma Rarieda e komiti moro mar od Bura.

eng: Many former foot soldiers of Raila attended Friday’s meeting convened by Owalo, who is also a former aide to the ODM leader.
luo: Ji mang'eny ma yande ringo koni gi koni ka gikonyo Raila ne nitie e chokruok ma Owalo ne obedogo chieng' Tich Abich. Owalo bende ne en achiel kuom joma ne konyo  Raila ahinya.

eng: They include those who decamped after losing ODM nominations in the 2013 and 2017 elections, among them former Kisumu Governor Jack Ranguma, former Rongo MP Dalmas Otieno and former Rangwe MP Martin Ogindo.
luo: Joma ne ni e chokruogno oriwo joma ne oweyo ODM kane  patino ok omiyogi kombe e yiero mag 2013 kod 2017.  Ji kaka Jack Ranguma ma en Gavana machon ma Kisumu, Dalmas Otieno Jabunge machon ma Rongo kod Martin Ogindo Jabunge machon ma Rangwe.

eng: Ranguma is hoping to challenge Governor Anyang’ Nyong’o for the Kisumu seat.
luo: Ranguma dwaro golo Gavana Anyang’ Nyong’o  mondo en ema obed gavana ma Kisumu.

eng: A source who did not wish to be named said those present were warming up to join United Democratic Alliance (UDA), which is associated with the deputy president.
luo: Wach ne owuok kamoro ni joma ne nie chokruogno paro mar donjo e pati mar United Democratic Alliance (UDA), ma en pati mar jalup Ker, kata kamano, ng'at ma ne ogolo wachno ok dwar ni ohul nyinge.

eng: “We want to challenge ODM’s dominance in the Nyanza region. Our goal is to rally the region to support Ruto’s presidential bid,” said the source.
luo: “Ng'atno wacho niya: Wadwaro kedo mondo ODM owe wiko e Nyanza duto. Wadwaro wuoyo gi Jo Nyanza mondo gigo ne  Ruto ombulu mondo okaw kom mar Ker."

eng: The politician claimed that they have the blessings of Ruto to organise the meeting with one of the agendas being to look for ways to attract more Nyanza leaders to their camp.
luo: Jasiasano wacho ni Ruto ne oyienegi bedo gi chokruogno. Kendo achiel kuom gik ma ne gidwaro timo ne en manyo yore ma ginyalo ywayogo jotelo mamoko mag Nyanza mondo odonj e patigino.

eng: The strategy also involves attracting professionals from the region who will help compile the economic needs of the region in a document that will form the basis for Ruto’s campaigns in Nyanza.
luo: Chenrogi oriwo ywayo  josomo ma Nyanza mabiro konyogi loso ripot mar dongruok madwarore e alworano, kendo ripotno ema ibiro tigo e manyo ombulu ne Ruto Nyanza.

eng: The group issued a statement saying it was reviewing Nyanza’s economy with the aim of finding ways to improve it.
luo: Jo grubno ne ogolo ripot ma wacho ni ginono dongruok ma Nyanza kendo gidwaro manyo yore ma ginyalo kelogo dongruok momedore.

eng: Owalo accused unnamed leaders from Nyanza of being preoccupied with the pursuit of political power and failing to address the economic problems of the region.
luo: Owalo ne owacho ni josiasa moko ma Nyanza dwaro mana telo to ok gichomre gi wach tieko dhier ma Nyanza. Kata kamano, ne ok ohulo nyinge jotelogo.

eng: Luo Nyanza has supported Raila since his first attempt at the presidency in 1997.
luo: Luo Nyanza osebedo ka goyo ombulu ne Raila mondo okaw kom mar ker chakre higa mar  1997.

eng: In 2013, President Uhuru Kenyatta, with the help of the former secretary-general of the disbanded.
luo: E higa mar  2013, Ker Uhuru Kenyatta ne otemo tiyo gi  Onyango Oloo  mondo omany ombulu Nyanza.

eng: The National Alliance party Onyango Oloo tried to make inroads in the region, but residents voted for the opposition leader.
luo: Onyango Oloo ne oyudo nie pati mar The National Alliance to gie kindeno jopatino ne osewere. Kata kamano, Jo Nyanza ne ogoyo ombulu ne Raila.

eng: Lecturer awarded Sh 416,000 for breach of contract
luo: Kot ong'ado ni ochul japuonj kolej siling 416,000 nikech kolej  ne ok orito winjruok ma ne gitimo kode

eng: Apart-time lecturer has been awarded Sh416,000 after his employer breached his contract by refusing to pay him salary for eleven months.
luo: Kot ne ong'ado ni ochul japuonj kolej siling 416,000. Japuonjno ne puonjo mana kuom seche matin e kolejno, kendo kolej ne ok otimo kaka ne giwinjre mi ne ok ochule kuom dweche apar gachiel.

eng: The court ruled that the evidence by the E-Smart Technical College lecturer Tobias Andhala would be fully adopted as the college failed to step in court even after being served with a notice.
luo: Kot ne owacho ni gibiro tiyo gi weche ma Tobias Andhala ne owacho nikech weg kolej ne ok obiro e kot kata obedo ni kot ne omiyogi barua manyiso ni idwarogi kuno.  Tobias Andhala en japuonj e  E-Smart Technical College.

eng: “Andhala testified on March 4, 2021, and his testimony was not challenged or rebutted, and the court will enter a judgment for him in the sum of Sh416,000 that he demanded from the College,” said Justice Stephen Radido of Kisumu Labour Court on Friday.
luo: Stephen Radido ma en Jang'ad Bura ma  Kisumu Labour Court, ne owacho niya Tich Abich, "Mach Tarik 4, 2021, Andhala ne olero ywakne e kot to onge ng'at ma ne okwedo gik ma ne owacho. Omiyo kot chiko ni ochule siling 416,000 ma ne okwayo ni kolejno ochule.”

eng: Andhala was employed as a part-time lecturer at the College on June 28, 2015, and by May 27, 2016, the College had not fully paid his salary.
luo: Ne ondik Andhala tich e kolejno Jun tarik 28, 2015, to chop Mei 27, 2016, ne pok ochule msache duto.

eng: On September 5, 2017, he escalated the dispute at the Labour Court after efforts to compel his employer to pay him.
luo: Septemba tarik 5, 2017, ne otero ywakne e  Labour Court   bang' temo wuoyo gi jo kolej mondo ochule.

eng: “The college was served the court papers through its secretary on October 26, 2017, but it did not file a response,” said Radido.
luo: Radido ne owacho niya: "Jandiko mar kot ne otero ne kolejno barua Oktoba tarik 26, 2017,  to jo kolej ne ok obiro e kot."

eng: This prompted the court to direct that the case proceeds without the party that had defied court summons.
luo: Mano ne omiyo kot ong'ado ni kesno odhi adhiya nyime kata obedo ni joma odonjnegigo onge, nimar gifwayo ote mar kot.

eng: At the close of the hearing of the case, the court was convinced that Andhala had a contract with the college which was abused.
luo: Bang' winjo kesno, kot ne oneno ni en adier ni Andhala ne odonjo e winjruok gi kolej to kolej ne ok orito winjruokgino.

eng: Justice Radido further ordered that the award would accrue interest from September 5, 2017, when the case was filed.
luo: Radido ne omedo owacho ni pesago ne ochako nyuolre chieng' ma ne ohang ter wachno e kot, Septemba tarik 5, 2017. Omiyo ne ochiko ni ochul Andhalo pesago duto.

eng: The court directed Andhala to settle all the legal costs in the suit.
luo: Kot ne onyiso Andhala ni obiro chulo kot ne tije duto  ma odhi e kesno.

eng: Police in Kisumu have arrested a 63-year-old woman in connection with theft of mosquito nets which were stolen from government stores.
luo: Polise ma Kisumu omako miyo moro ma jahigni 63. Miyono otudre gi kuo net mag suna ma ne okwal kuonde keno mag sirkal.

eng: Police said they recovered 19 bales of nets suspected to be part of those stolen from Rabuor and Nyang’ande two weeks ago.
luo: Polise wacho ni ne giyudo miyono gi bel 19 mag net. Gichich ni gin moko kuom net ma ne okwal  Rabuor kod Nyang’ande jumbe ariyo mokalo.

eng: Officers from Obunga Police Station, working on a tip-off from the public, raided a house at USAID Estate on Friday and nabbed the woman.
luo: Raia ne okwalo wach ne polise ma Obunga  kendo polise ne odhi e od miyono USAID Estate Tich Abich mi gimako miyono.

eng: She was taken to Obunga Police Station after failing to explain the source of the nets, then transferred to Central Police Station where she was booked.
luo: Nikech ne ok onyisogi kama ne ogoloe netgo ne gitere Obunga Polis Stesen kae to gitere  Central Police Station kama ne okawie nonrone kendo ondik kuo ma ne ichich ni otudrego.

eng: The woman was later moved to Ahero Police Station in Ntyando, where the initial report about the loss of the nets was made.
luo: Bang'e ne oter miyono  Ahero Polis Stesen, Nyando, kama ne ohang terie ripot mar net ma ne olal.

eng: Kisumu Central sub-county police commander James Ng’etich said they are investigating the matter.
luo: James Ng’etich, ma en police kamanda ma  Kisumu Central sab-kaunti, wacho ni ginono wachno.

eng: “We decided to hand the suspect to officers in Ahero since the theft had been reported there and they had also arrested other suspects,” said Ng’etich
luo: Ng'etich ne owacho ni, " Ne wang'ado mar keto miyono e lwet polise ma Ahero nikech kuno ema ne oterie ripot mar kuo net kendo  gisemako jomoko kuno bende."

eng: The county launched the distribution of treated mosquito nets to residents two weeks ago in an exercise that will see at least 790, 000 nets given to 1.2 million people.
luo: Kauntino ne ochako chiwo net moseketie yath jumbe ariyo mokalo. Gin gi chenro mar miyo ji milion 1.2 net 790, 000 ka tin.

eng: The nets had been kept in various stores, mostly hospitals and schools within Kisumu’s seven sub-counties.
luo: Thoth netgo ne okan kuonde mopogore opogore e sab kaunti abiriyo mag Kisumu. Ng'enyne, ne okan-gi e kuonde keno mag osiptande kod skunde.

eng: However, the exercise was halted in parts of Nyando after it was discovered 340 bales, each containing 50 nets, had disappeared from Rabuor and Nyang’ande hospitals.
luo: "Kata kamano, ne ochung wach chiwo net kuonde moko Nyando ka ne ofweny ni bel 340 moting'o net 50, 50 ne olal e osiptande mag Rabuor kod Nyang'ande."

eng: County Malaria Coordinator Lilyana Dayo, who was coordinating the distribution of the nets, noted that the theft was discovered on the day the distribution was to begin.
luo: Lilyana Dayo, Mochung' ne Weche Malaria e Kaunti kendo ma ne ochung' ne wach chiwo net ne owacho ni ne ofweny ni netgo onge chieng' ma ne onego ochak pog ji net.

eng: At least four officials from the two hospitals were arrested in connection with the theft.
luo: Jotelo ang'wen e osiptande ariyogo osemak nikech wach kuono.

eng: The arrest of the 63-year-old woman at Obunga however marked the first breakthrough in the investigations after police discovered 19 bales of mosquito nets suspected to be part of those that were stolen.
luo: Miyo ma jahigni  63 ma polise ne omako Obunga gi bel 19 mag net, e ng'at mokwong mak e kuono.

eng: The police said the woman told them she was selling the nets on behalf of an individual she declined to name.
luo: Polise wacho ni miyono ne owachonegi ni ouso netgo e lo ng'ato, kata kamano, otamore hulo nying ng'atno.

eng: Nyando sub-county police boss Lewnard Matete said the woman will remain in custody until Monday when she will be arraigned.
luo: Lewnard Matete, ma en Jatend Polis, Nyando sab-kaunti ne owacho ni miyono biro bet e sel nyaka Wuok Tich mondo otere e kot.

eng: Matete said the suspect had been uncooperative and has declined to divulge information regarding the nets.
luo: Matete wacho ni miyono ok dwar konyogi fwenyo jokuoyego. Otamore golo weche motudre gi kuo mar netgo.

eng: “She keeps changing her story. Police are unable to trace the movement of the nets because the suspect does not want to give information.
luo: “Osiko oloko weche. Polise ok nyal ng'eyo kaka netgo ne owuotho nikech miyono ok dwar hulo gik mong'eyo.

eng: She is now claiming she cannot recall the name or identity and does not even have the contacts of the person she claims delivered the nets to her house for storage. The suspect says all she knows is that the person comes from Busia,” said Matete.
luo: Matete wacho ni, "Koro miyono wacho ni ok onyal paro nyingi ng'at ma ne okelo netgo mondo okan e ode kendo onge gima ong'eyo kuom ng'atno, mak mana ni owuok Busia. Owacho ni oonge kata mana nambane mar simu."

eng: Efforts by the suspect’s kin to have her released on police bond failed.
luo: Wede miyono ne kwayo ni gichul bond mar polis mondo ogonye to polise ne otamore.

eng: “With this kind of conflicting information, it is not safe for us to grant her police bond. She will have to wait in the cells until Monday when she will go to court,” said Matete.
luo: Matete ne owacho ni: "Nikech miyoni gwenyo weche ahinya, ok dwamiye bond mar polis, di po ka olalnwa. Nyaka orita arita e sel nyaka Wuok Tich mondo odhi e kot."

eng: The implementation of a multi-million-shilling project launched by Dr Ida Odinga in Homa Bay County could delay because of a stalemate between the contractor and Kenya Power.
luo: Chenro mar gedo mar Dr Ida Odinga  e kaunti mar Homa Bay nyalo digni  nikech ywarruok manie kind jal mochung' ne gedono kod jo Kenya Power.

eng: The project christened Dr Ida Odinga Library, Research, Innovation and Resource Centre is under construction at Ogande Girls High School in Homa Bay Town Constituency and is expected to cost over Sh300 million.
luo: Iluongo kama ogerono ni  Dr Ida Odinga Library, Research, Innovation and Resource Centre kendo igere Ogande Girls High School man Homa Bay Town Constituency. Iwacho ni en gedo mabiro kawo milion 300.

eng: The project started in December last year after a groundbreaking ceremony presided over by Interior Cabinet Secretary Fred Matiang’i, his education counterpart Prof George Magoha and Dr Ida.
luo: Ne ochak gedo Desemba higa mokalo bang' nyasi maratipo ma ne ochung'ne gi Fred Matiang’i ma en Jatend Sirkal Mochung'ne Somo, nyawadgi  Prof George Magoha, kod Dr Ida.

eng: Its foundation is complete but the construction cannot go on because of electricity cables hanging over the site.
luo: Osetiek mise, kata kamano, gedo ok nyal dhi nyime nikech weyini mag stima oliero kar gedo.

eng: The cables supply electricity to Suneka town in Kisii County from Homa Bay town.
luo: Weyini mag stimago golo stima Homa Bay katero e  taon ma Suneka man e Kaunti ma Kisii.

eng: Homa Bay Town MP Peter Kaluma who toured the project accused Kenya Power of failing to move the cables.
luo: Peter Kaluma ma en Jabunge ma Taon ma Homa Bay  ne odhi neno  kanyo. Ne owacho ni jo Kenya Power ema otamore chwalo weyinigo.

eng: “The contractor has told me he asked Kenya Power to relocate the power lines but the organisation has not done so. The company should move with speed and relocate the power lines. Electric cables hang above the site hence the work cannot continue,” said Kaluma.
luo: Kaluma wacho niya: "Ng'at mochung' ne gedono wacho ni osenyiso jo Kenya Power mondo ochwal weyinigo kamachielo, to pok gitimo kamano. Onego gi chwal weyinigo mapiyo nikech weyinigo kalo kama owinjore ogedie, kendo tich ok nyal dhi nyime."

eng: The MP said the cost of the project is likely to go up if the stalemate persists.
luo: Jabungeno ne owacho ni ka ywarruokno odhi nyime kendo tich ochung',  pesa mibiro tigo e gedo biro medore.

eng: “The stalemate must be resolved. We want to see the project completed as planned delay in implementation of a project has financial implications hence this matter must be handled with the seriousness it deserves,” Kaluma said.
luo: "Kaluma ne owacho niya: "Onego otiek ywarruokno, kendo tich odhi nyime. Wadwaro ni otiek gik migero kae. Sama tich digni, pes gedo medore omiyo wadwaro ni omi wachni pek madwarore."

eng: Homa Bay County Kenya Power Manager Ken Okumbe said his office is aware of the stalemate and has given the contractor a quotation of the fee he is supposed to pay to facilitate the relocation of the power lines.
luo: Ken Okumbe ma en Jatelo mar  Kenya Power e Homa Bay Kaunti wacho ni ong'eyo wachno kendo osenyiso jal mochung' ne gedono pesa monego ochul mondo ogol weyinigo kama gintiere kendo otergi kamachielo.

eng: “It is true they reported the matter to our office. We gave them the quotation for rerouting the power line but they have not paid,” said Okumbe.
luo: Okumbe wacho niya: " En adier, ni  ne gikelo wachno e ofiswa. Ne wanyisogi nengo mar loko ndach stimano to pok gichulowa."

eng: The project aims at establishing a library with a capacity of 500 students, an amphitheatre that can accommodate 1,000 people, an ICT hub and a creative centre with a recording studio.
