luo: Serikal ma piny mar kauntino, noketo milion 35 tenge higni ariyo mokalo mondo okony e bero, gero, kendo loso  sikundno. Gi ma sikundno ne onego otim en yie ne jo kaunti osom e skundno nono.

eng: However, Moi University administration pulled out, letting go all the workers who had remained at the campus, forcing it to close.
luo: Kata kamano, jo ma ochung' ne mbalariany ma Moi University nowere gi skundno kendo ne giyie mondo jo ma ne tiyo e sikundno owuogi to  mano nomiyo olore.

eng: But there have been plans by other higher learning institutions seeking to take over the college.
luo: To nitie chenro ma itimo gi mbalariany mamoko mondo gikaw sikundno.

eng: Karachuonyo constituency ODM officials have told political leaders to end clan politics in Homa Bay County.
luo: Ofisa mag ODM e od bura ma Karachuonyo okwayo jotend siasa mondo giwere gi siasa mapogo dho udi e kaonti mar Homa Bay.

eng: Addressing journalists at a Homa Bay hotel on Sunday, ODM chairpersons from the six wards in Karachuonyo Constituency and the constituency chair have denounced clan politics if the county is to elect a good governor.
luo: Jokom mar ODM ma wuok e ward auchiel ma nitie e od bura ma Karachuonyo kaachiel gi jakomb ODM ma od burano, nowuoyo gi jofwamb kod keyo weche ka gin e hotel moro e taon mar Homa Bay chieng' Jumapil. Ne gikwedo mokalo siasa mag anyuola ka giwacho ni mano nyalo mono kauntino yudo gavana mowinjore.

eng: The leaders were speaking after claims by some contenders that the Rachuonyo clan which comprises Karachuonyo, Kasipul and Kabondo-Kasipul constituencies will decide who becomes the next Homa Bay governor in 2022 because of their numerical advantage.
luo: Jotelo nowuoyo bang' jotelo moko ma dwa ni oyiergi nosieko gi wach moro ni Jo-Karachunyo moting'o od bura ma Karachuonyo, Kasipul, kod Kabondo-Kasipul e ma nigi teko mar yiero jal ma biro bedo gavana e kaunti ma Homa Bay e higa mar 2022 nikech gin e ma ging'eny.

eng: They argued that Rachuonyo clan has more voters than other clans in the county.
luo: Jogo ne wacho ni Jo-Karachuonyo e ma nigi jogo ombulu mathoth moloyo dhoudi mamoko e kauntino.

eng: Kendu Bay Town Ward chairman Justus Osumba said the narrative is outdated and divisive, adding that cannot the county has eight constituencies.
luo: Justus Osumba ma e jakom ma Kendu Bay ward, nowacho ni mano en paro ma nyachon kendo ma pogo oganda, komedo wacho ni kauntino nigi od buche aboro.

eng: He argued that three constituencies alone cannot make a candidate win a gubernatorial seat.
luo: Nowacho ni ute buche adek kende ok nyal miyo ng'ato yomb jomamoko ma obed gavana.

eng: Osumba said there is a need for Rachuonyo clan to welcome gubernatorial candidates from other constituencies.
luo: Osumba nowacho ni dwarore mondo jo ma aa Rachuonyo osir ng'ama dwa bedo gavana mowuok eod buche mamoko.

eng: “We are only three constituencies hence our sons and daughters who want to vie for the seat cannot succeed without the support of voters from other constituencies,” Osumba said.
luo: Nowacho kama: "Wan mana gi od buche adek kende. Omiyo, ok nyalre mondo yawuotwa kod nyiwa obed gavana ka ok osirgi gi jo ma wuok e od buche mamoko.

eng: The senior citizen said clannism will deny the county good candidates for the County top seat, adding that all candidates are welcomed to the larger Karachuonyo region.
luo: Jaduong'no ne owacho ni siasa mag anyuola mono kaontino yudo joma beyo mowinjore bedo jotelo mar kaonti kendo nowacho ni Karachuonyo duong' ma ji duto madwaro kom onego otem atema.

eng: “All those with desirable leadership qualities to ascend to power should do their campaigns across the county without discrimination,” said Osumba.
luo: Osumba nomedo wacho niya: "Ji duto ma nigi kido mar bedo jatelo maber onego otim kampen mag gi e kauntino duto ma ok obuon-gi.

eng: Karachuonyo Constituency Joshua Maena said politics of incitement and discrimination had been overtaken by events.
luo: Joshua Maeno ma en jachung' ma od bura ma Karachuonyo nowacho ni siasa ma ithuwie ji kod buono ji en gi ma nokalo nene.

eng: He said there is a need for politics of inclusivity to enable Homa Bay to get a good governor after the 2022 General Election.
luo: Nowacho ni dwarore mondo siasa oriw ji duto e ka kaunti ma Homa Bay nyalo yudo gavana maber bang' yiero maduong' ma 2022.

eng: “Let us stop discriminating people. This type of politics is obsolete,” said Maena.
luo: Maeno owacho kama: "Waweuru tim mar buono jomamoko. Kit siasa ma kama tinde onge."

eng: He cautioned leaders against branding others as 'outsiders' during politics to achieve their selfish political interests.
luo: Nosiemo jotelo ma luongo jomoko ni jolimbamba e kinde siasa mana ni mondo gin e ma yiergi.

eng: “You find a man who has lived in an area since childhood is branded an outsider when he ventures into politics. Segregation is wrong,” Odero said.
luo: Odero nowacho niya: "Iyudo ka iluongo ng'at mosedak kamoro nyaka ne nyuole ni jalimbamba sama odonjo e weche siasa. Pogo ji e yo ma kamano en gi ma rach miwuoro."

eng: Some of the political leaders who are eyeing the county gubernatorial include Deputy Governor Hamilton Orata, Woman Rep Gladys Wanga, County Secretary Isaiah Ogwe, businessman Jared Otieno, former Nairobi Governor Evans Kidero, KUPPET Secretary General Akello Misori, ODM National Chairman John Mbadi and politician Luis Otieno.
luo: Moko kuom jotelo ma olap dhogi chuer ne komb gavana oriwo Hamilton Orata ma e jalup gavana ma sani, Gladys Wanga ma sani en Woman Rep, Isaiah Ogwe ma en jagoro mar kaunti, Jared Otieno ma en jatim ohala, Evans Kidero ma ne en gavana ma chon ma Nairobi, Akello Misori ma en Secretary General mar KUPPET, John Mbadi ma en jakom mar chama mar ODM, kod Luis Otieno ma be en jasiasa.

eng: They want to succeed Governor Cyprian Awiti who is serving his second term.
luo: Gidwaro ni gikaw kar Cyprian Awiti ma e gavana ma tiyo sani kendo ma kindene mar bedo e ofis orumo.

eng: Two children were killed after their house collapsed at Ururi village, Bondo Sub-County, on Saturday morning.
luo: Nyithindo ariyo ne otho chieng' Ngeso bang' odgi gore piny e gweng ma Uriri e sab kaonti ma Bondo

eng: The two, Juliana Achieng', 2, and Mary Achieng’,12, were sleeping in the house together with their parents when the incident happened.
luo: Nyithindo ariyogo ma moro iluongo ni Juliana Achieng' ma jahigni ariyo, kod nyamin-gi Mary Achieng' ma jahigni 12, ne nindo gi jonyuolgi sa ma ne masirano otimore.

eng: Their father, Fredrick Achieng’, who survived the tragedy, told The Standard that the incident happened at around midnight.
luo: Wuon-gi ma iluongo ni Fredrick Achieng' ma notony e kinde masirano, nonyiso jo gaset mar The Standard ni masirano notimore kar sa auchiel otieno.

eng: "Our roof was first blown off before the walls collapsed on us, killing our two children," said Achieng’.
luo: Achieng' wacho niya: "Tatwa e ma ne yamo okwango owalo kae to kor ot olwar kuomwa mi onego nyithindo ariyogo.

eng: He said villagers who rushed to the scene after they heard screams rescued them.
luo: Nowacho ni jogweng' ma nowinjo ka gigoyo nduru e ma noringo mobiro resogi.

eng: He appealed to well-wishers to help him get shelter and meet the burial expenses for his two children.
luo: Nokwayo ni jo ma chunygi ler mondo okonye gi pesa oyud ot machielo kendo oyik nyithinde ariyogo.

eng: The bodies were taken to Bondo sub-county hospital mortuary.
luo: Ringre nyithindogo noter e od kano ringre jo ma otho e osiptal mar Bondo sab kaonti.

eng: The late Keziah Obama has today been laid to rest at her Kogelo village in Siaya county.
luo: Ringre Keziah Obama kawuono noyik e gweng mar Kogelo e kaunti ma Siaya.

eng: The late Keziah was the mother of former US President Barack Obama’s half-brother, Malik Abong’o Obama.
luo: Ne en min Malik Abong'o Obama ma en owadgi Ker machon ma Amerka Barack Obama.

eng: She died on April 13, 2021, while receiving treatment at a UK-based hospital.
luo: Keziah notho tarik 13 April, 2021 ka noyudo thieth e osiptal moro man UK.

eng: Mama Keziah was the spouse of the late Barack Obama senior. She was 78 years at the time of her death.
luo: Mama Keziah Obama ne en chi Barach Obama senior. Notho kojahigni 78.

eng: Her body arrived in Kenya on Friday morning before it was transported to Kogelo where she was buried.
luo: Ringrene nochopo Kenya chieng' Tich Abich okinyi, eka otere Kogelo kama noyike.

eng: Malik, who is the eldest son while speaking on behalf of the family eulogised his mother as a loving and responsible woman.
luo: Malik ma e wuoyi makayo, nochiwo nend min-gi kowacho ni ne en miyo mohero ji kendo ma nokawo ting'ne.

eng: Among leaders who attended the burial were; Siaya Deputy Governor James Okumbe, Senator James Orengo and Rarieda MP Otiende Amollo.
luo: Moko kuom jotelo ma nodhi e ikne oriwo: James Okumbe ma en jalup gavana ma Siaya,  James Orengo ma en seneta ma Siaya, kod Jaod Bura ma Rarieda, Otiende Amollo.

eng: Speakers eulogised mama Keziah as an inspiring woman, who had brought up a great family.
luo: Jo ma nowuoyo e liende nowacho ni Keziah ne en miyo ma ne jiwo ji, kendo ma nopidho kiye mageny kendo ne omiye luor.

eng: Orengo said his relationship with the Obama family dates back to the years when Senior Barack Obama was alive.
luo: Orengo nowacho ni nochako ng'eyo jood Obama e kinde ma Senior Barack Obama ne pod ngima.

eng: He described the late Senior Obama as a reputable economist.
luo: Nolero ni Obama Senior ne en  ng'at ma nong'ere ahinya molony  e weche mag pesa.

eng: Orengo said the late Senior Obama was among the team of economic specialists who worked on the sessional paper number 10 of 1969 that guided the development of Kenya for decades.
luo: Nowacho ni Obama ne en achiel kuom jolony ma noloso weche ma ne dhi tayo ochumi ma Kenya ma iluongo gi Kisungu ni sessional paper number 10 of 1969 kendo gino nokonyo piny Kenya kuom higni pieche.

eng: "He was a great scholar who did his studies in several universities and later returned to Kenya where he worked as an economist in the Ministry of economic planning. He worked with other great ministers who were also my friends like the late Tom Mboya," he said.
luo: Nowacho kama: "Obama ne en jasomo mang'ula ma nosomo e mbalariany mopogore opogore, kendo noduogo Kenya kama notiye kaka economist maduong'  e bwo migawo mar economic planning. Bende, notiyo gi jochung' ne migepe madongo-dongo kendo mopogore opogore ma bende ne gin osiepega kaka Tom Mboya."

eng: MP Otiende said the Obama family has elevated Kenya to the international map by producing the first black president in the US.
luo: Migosi Otiende Amollo to nowacho ni od Obama omiyo piny Kenya obedo e rang'iny mamalo e piny ngima kuom golo ker mokwongo e piny Amerka ma nigi remb Africa.

eng: "This is one family that has given us so much pride. We are on the international map because of them. Their son, former US President  Obama put us on an international map," noted Otiende.
luo: Otiende nowacho niya: "Joodni osemiyowa nyadhi malich. Ong'ewa e piny mangima nikech gin. Wuodgi ma ne en ker machon mar piny Amerka e momiyo mano en kamano."

eng: Deputy Governor  Okumbe also described the Obama's as a great family that had uplifted not only the image of the country but Siaya county as well.
luo: Migosi Okombe ma en jalup gavana bende nowacho ni jood Obama gin joot ma nigi huma ahinya nikech gise ng'awo yo ma inenogo pinywa, kod kaunti ma Siaya bende.

eng: Okumbe said he is a friend to the family through Auma  Obama who was his great friend.
luo: Ne omedo wacho ni Auma Obama en osiepne mogeno kendo ni en osiep joodno kokalo kuome.

eng: "Auma and I have done a lot of development projects, especially for the Kogelo family. She has always invited me for her functions for the community where she gives back through projects," added Okumbe.
luo: Nowacho niya: "An kaachiel gi Auma wasetimo gik mathoth ma kelo dongruok ahinya ne gweng' ma Kogelo. Osebedo kogwela seche ma en gi projekt moko motimo e gweng'ni kokonyogigo."

eng: The late Mama Keziah was buried a few minutes after 1pm in accordance with the Muslim rites.
luo: Ringre Mama Keziah noyik dakika moko matin bang' sa abiriyio ka luwore gi chike jo Islam.

eng: Two security guards were on Thursday night brutally murdered at Ndondi market centre in Alego Usonga, Siaya County.
luo: Askeche moko ariyo ne oneg e yo malit chieng' Tich Ang'wen gotieno e chiro ma Ndondi ma yudore Alengo Usonga e kaunti ma  Siaya.

eng: Baragulu assistant chief Maurice Abudha said they also found the body of another watchman who was manning a building with a shop and a bar.
luo: Maurice Abudha ma en jalup chif ma Baragulu, nowacho ni ne oyud ringre askari machielo ma rito ot ma nigi duka kod od matho kongo.

eng: The two were manning a local bar and hardware store at the market centre.
luo: Askeche ariyo ma noyud koneg go, ne rito ba (kar madho kuong') kod hadware moro e chirono.

eng: "The two watchmen were killed by robbers who broke into the shop and hardware store. They got away with a lot of goods from both the shop and hardware store," he said.
luo: Nowacho kama: "Askeche ariyogo ne onegi gi jomahundu moko ma noturo duka mar hadware mane girito, kendo jo njore go ne gikwalo mwandu mathoth kowuok kuom hadware kod dukano."

eng: The bodies of the two watchmen had deep machete cuts on the head.
luo: Ringre askechego ne oyud ka nigi alama ma nyiso ni ne ochadhgi gi ojala e wigi.

eng: Siaya OCPD Bernard Muriuki said the police had launched investigations to nab the culprits.
luo: Jatend polis ma (OCPD) ma Siaya migosi Benard Muriuki, a owacho ni polis osechako timo nonro mar manyoachije motimo tim mahunduno.

eng: "I cannot give details at this time. We have just started the investigation," he said.
luo: Nowacho niya: "Ok dak awach weche mathoth gie sani. Eka sani wachako timo apedhawa ne jogo."

eng: Meanwhile, residents in the area have called for increased police patrols, citing increasing cases of insecurity.
luo: Gie sechego jodak ma kono kwayo ni mondo polise omed timo kachero e alworano ka giwacho ni timbe ma kamago osemedore ahinya e alworano.

eng: Martha Awino, a businesswoman at the centre, said several shops were broken into and goods stolen last month.
luo: Martha Awino ma be timo ohala e chirono, nowacho ni nitie duke mogwarore ma osetur kendo mwandu man e igi okwal dwe mokalo.

eng: She said a watchman was killed at the market centre last year.
luo: Nowacho bende ni jarito machielo be noneg e chirono higa mokalo.

eng: The perennial water shortage in Homa Bay town will finally end after the Lake Victoria South Water Works Development Agency (LVSWWDA) purchased Sh200 million water distribution equipment to fix it.
luo: Pi ma osebedo ka chendo e boma ma Homa Bay kuom kinde malach koro biro rumo bang' Lake Victoria South  Water Works Development Agency (LVSWWDA) nyiewo gik ma kowo pi ma nokawo siling' milion 200.

eng: The equipment imported from Belgium includes steel water pipes, water pumps and other items used for constructing water supply systems.
luo: Gigo nonyiew kowuok piny Belgium kendo giriwo olalo mag chuma, gima thuri pi (pom) kod gik mamoko ma idhi tigo e gero chenro mar kowo pi.

eng: LVSWWDA chairperson Dan Omino and Homa Bay Water Sewerage and Sanitation Company managing director Evans Nyagol received the consignment on Thursday, April 29.
luo: Jakom mar LVSWWDA, Dan Owino kod dairekta mar Homa Bay Water Sewerage and Sanitation Company, Evans Nyagol, ne nitie ka ne gigo ochopo chieng' Tich Ang'wen April 29.

eng: Omino said the equipment will complete a mega water project christened, Homa Bay Cluster Water Supply Project, funded by the National Government in collaboration with Belgium through the LVSWWDA.
luo: Omino nowacho ni gigo ibo tigo e loso chenro ma radhai mar keyo pi kendo ibiro luonge ni Homa Bay  Cluster   Water Project ka pesa mosire ogol gi sirikal ma malo ka giriwore gi piny Belgium kendo ka gitiyo gi LVSWWDA.

eng: Homa Bay town, the administrative headquarter of the county, face shortage with the current water treatment plant producing only 2.5 million litres per day instead of the required 5 million litres.
luo: Taon mar Homa Bay, kod ofis maduong' mar kauntino ok yud pi moromo kowuok e kar thiedho pi ma gi e sana golo mana lita milion ariyo gi nus odiechieng' kar pi lita milion 5 ma dwarore odiechieng' kodiechieng'.

eng: Omino said once completed, the new project will produce 8.8 million litres of water per day.
luo: Omino nomedo wacho ni ka projektno orumo to obiro golo pi lita milion 8.8 e odiechieng'.

eng: He said the project will meet the needs of the growing population of the area residents for the next 20 years.
luo: Nomedo wacho ni projektno biro chopo dwach jo ma odak e taondno ma kwan-gi siko ka medore kendo pod biro dhi nyime timo kamano kuom higni 20 ma biro.

eng: “This project will produce excess water which will take care of the needs of the growing population for the next 20 years. This means a shortage of water can only occur in this area after two decades,” said Omino.
luo: Nowacho kama: "Projektni biro golo pi mang'eny momedore ma biro chopo dwach kwan ji ma medore e taondni kuom higni 20 ma biro. Mano nyiso ni pi biro mana remo jo ma odak e taondni higni 20 ma biro!"

eng: Omino added that the project will majorly use solar energy to pump the water.
luo: Ne omedo wacho ni projektno biro tiyo gi teko chieng' (solar) kinde mang'eny mondo okow pi.

eng: “Electricity will only be used where there is no solar energy. But we intend to rely on solar,” he said.
luo: Nowacho niya: "Wabiro tiyo mana gi teko sitima mana ka ok nyalore tiyo gi solar. Kata kamano, dwachwa en ni mondo wati gi solar kata teko mar wang' chieng."

eng: The major component of the project encompasses piping of water from Lake Victoria to a treatment plant to produce clean water which is to be pumped to the residents’ taps for consumption.
luo: Gima duong' ma projektno biro timo en golo pi kowuok Lake Victoria kendo keye gi odudu mabor nyaka kama idhi thiedhe kata chinge mondo ogolo pi maliw kendo maler, kae to ikeye ne ji mondo oti kode.

eng: He said the agency is about to complete another component of the project in Rodi Kopany Township which will produce 400,000 litres of water through two boreholes
luo: Nowacho ni bende gichiegni tieko projekt machielo ma kamano ma ni Rodi Kopany Township ma biro golo pi lita 400,000 kowuok dag pi ariyo madongo.

eng: Nyagol said pumping of water using solar will prevent huge electricity bills which had impeded their efforts in the past.
luo: Nyagol a owacho ni keyo pi kitiyo gi solar kelo kungo mar pesa mathoth mitiyogo e chulo sitima kendo mano ne chandogiga kinde mokalo.

eng: The electricity bills had frequently disrupted the water supply when Kenya Power disconnected their power supply.
luo: Pesa ma nichulogo sitima ne miyo ng'ikruok betie e tij kowo pi kinde ma ne Kenya Power ne ng'adonegi sitima nikech gowi.

eng: “We are going to supply water stably upon completion of this mega project and water shortage will be history here,” Nyagol said.
luo: Nyagol ne owacho kama: "Wabiro keyo pi e yo ma onge ng'ikruok kata matin ka projektni orumo, kendo gimoro ma ne timore e kinde mokalo ni pi onge, ok nochak otimre ngang'."

eng: He told residents to be ready to receive water from the project.
luo: Nonyiso jo ma odak e alworano obed moikore yudo pi ma projektno biro kelo.

eng: The project which started in March 2019 is expected to end in November this year.
luo: Tijno nochakore e dwe mar Mach 2019 kendo igeno ni obiro rumo dwe mar apar gachiel e higani.

eng: The Nubian community has called on authorities to improve conditions at a field in Kolwa, Kisumu County, where they are living in makeshift structures after they were evicted from a disputed land.
luo: Oganda mar Wanubi okwayo sirkal otimie gimoro e wi kar dakgi ma ni Kolwa  e Kaunti ma Kisumo, kama gidak e ute mojong bang' ka noseriembgi kama ne gidakie kilaro wach lobno.

eng: They have also urged the county government to expedite the process of resettling them.
luo: Gikwayo sirkal mar kaunti bende mondo oruregi miyogi kar dak machielo.

eng: Kenya Railways (KR) has laid claim to the land in Kibos, which the Nubians say was given to them by the colonial government in 1937.
luo: Riwruok mar reru ma Kenya miluongo ni Kenya Railways (KR) nogolo ng'ur e wi lobno ka Jo-Wanubi to wacho ni nomigi lobno gi sirkal machon e higa mar 1937.

eng: The field, next to Kisumu East CDF office, is prone to floods that have made life difficult, especially for the elderly.
luo: Kama gijotie sani ni machiegni gi ofis Kisumu East CDF  thoro pong'ga ka koth chue, kendo osemiyo ngima obedo mateknegi, to ahinya ahinya ne joma hikgi oniang'.

eng: KR accused them of encroaching on land meant for expansion of the railway line and forcefully evicted them.
luo: KR nowacho ni jogo nodak e lo ma ne onego bed ni itiyogo kiyaro ndach reru to mano e momiyo ne gidarogi gi thuon.

eng: The Nubians say their eviction was illegal.
luo: Jo-Nubi to wacho ni nodargi kanyo e yo ma ok owinjore.

eng: They were moved to the land where they are currently living by the Kisumu City authorities.
luo: Sirkal ma kaonti ma Kisumo e ma nodarogi nyaka kama koro gijotie sani.

eng: “We had lived on the land since 1937 before we were forcefully evicted. It has been tough for some of us, especially those of us who are elderly,” said 82-year-old Khadija Rajab.
luo: Khadija Rajab ma jahigni 82 wacho kama: "Wasebet ka wadak e lobno chakre higa mar 1937 kae to koro iriembowa. Ngima ok osebedonwa mayot, to ahinya ahinya ne wan joma koro oti."

eng: The 850 people have been living in deplorable conditions for three months now since they were evicted from what KR says was a railway reserve.
luo: Ji 850 osebet kodak kuonde ma ok owinjore gi ngima kuom dweche adek koro chakre ne riembgi giwuog kama Kenya Railways (KR) luongo ni kar reru.

eng: “We did not expect this. But if we must move out so the railway can be expanded, then the government should compensate us,” she said.
luo: Nowacho kama,"Ne ok wang'eyo ni gima kamano nyalo timore. To kochuno ni nyaka wadar mondo wawe nafas ne reru, sirkal onego ochulwa."

eng: Rajab said other than floods, they have to contend will mosquitoes and rodents.
luo: Rajab nowacho ni mopogore gi kodh ohula mayweyo udi, ginyagore bende gi suna kod oyieyo.

eng: She wondered why they were taken to the flood-prone field, a move she said has complicated their lives.
luo: Nowuoro gimomiyo nodargi motergi kama pi ng'enyie, gima osemiyo ngimagi obedo matek.

eng: They have been depending on Kenya Red Cross Society, relatives and well wishers for food.
luo: Gisebet ka gidak gi kony ma Red Cross, wedegi kod joma chunygi ler miyogi.

eng: Abdi Asha, 39, called for justice saying KR had no right to take away their land.
luo: Abdi Asha ma jahigni 39, ne okwayo mondo okonygi kowacho ni joreru onge gi ratiro mar kawo lopgi.

eng: “We are Kenyans by birth and deserve fair treatment,” Asha said.
luo: Asha nowacho kama, "Nonyuolwa Kenya kae kendo onego odew ratiro marwa."

eng: Most of those living on the 18 acres belonging to the county government cannot fend for themselves.
luo: Thoth jogo modak e lop sirkand kaonti ma Kisumu maromo eka 18 ok nyal kata yudo gik mochuno e ngima.

eng: Acting City Manager Abala Wanga said the county government has started the process of resettling the Nubians.
luo: Abala Wanga ma en City Manager, nowacho ni sirkand kaonti osechako chenro mar darone Jo-Wanubia kar dak manyien.

eng: In the meantime, Wanga said they had built three tents to improve their living conditions and were in the process of controlling floods at the site.
luo: Wanga nowacho ni gisegero hembe adek mondo okony ngima jogo kendo gisechako geng'o ohula mopong'o kanyo.

eng: Hassan Hussein, an elder, said they were happy the county government had started settling them, but urged the authorities to expedite the process.
luo: Hassan Hussein ma jaduong', nowacho ni omor  ni sirkand kaonti darogi ka terogi kamachielo kendo dohero kwayogi mondo gitim mano piyo.

eng: Last month, the Environment and Land Court extended conservatory orders stopping KR from forcefully evicting the Nubians from the land.
luo: Dwe mokalo, Kot mar Lowo kod Alwora ne owacho ni gitamo joreru kik odar githuon Jo-Wanubi e lopegi.

eng: This followed a petition by Fatuma Bilal, Rashid Sadii, Mohamed Abdulrahman, Mwanamisi Kinduli, Yaya Musa and Asaman Musa filed on behalf of the community.
luo: Mano notimore bang' ka Fatuma Bilal, Rashid Sadii, Mohamed Abdulrahman, Mwanamisi Kinduli, Yaya Musa kod Asaman Musa nodhi e kot e lo jogweng'.

eng: Man killed by crocodile in Lake Victoria, another survives attack
luo: Dichwo moro nyang' onego Nam Viktoria, dichwo machielo to ne otony

eng: A family in Wigwa village in Kisumu County has been left in grief after their kin was killed by a crocodile in Lake Victoria.
luo: Joot moro man e gweng' mar Wigwa e kaonti ma Kisumu okuyo bang' nyang' onego ng'atgi e  Nam Viktoria.

eng: Gabriel Okoth Oduogo, 35, was on a fishing expedition in the company of his friend when the incident happened at Nyandiwa beach.
luo: Gabriel Okoth Oduogo ma jahigni 35, ne odi lupo gi osiepne sama ne nyang' omakogi e dho wath ma Nyandiwa.

eng: His friend survived the attack but the incident caused panic all the way to Dunga beach where the fishermen trade.
luo: Osiepne ne otony kata kamano masirano ne okelo luoro nyaka e dho wath mar Dunga kama ji usoe.

eng: Eyewitnesses said the crocodile emerged from a nearby papyrus weed on the shoreline before it attacked the deceased by grabbing him.
luo: Joneno wacho ni nyang' ne owuok e togo ma ne nie dho wath momako jalupono monego.

eng: ''He was attacked by the reptile in the morning in the company of others who had gone to lay fishing nets to harvest fish,” Saitoti Ayoro said.
luo: Saitoti Ayoro nowacho kama, "Nyang' nomake gokinyi ka ne odhi mako rech kanyachiel gi jowetene kama gi jaketo net mag mako rech."

eng: He cried for help as his shaken colleagues ran for their lives before they gathered courage a few minutes later to hurl stones at the reptile as it swam and dived in the water.
luo: Ne oywak kokwayo kony sama osiepene ne oringo nikech luoro, kata kamano ne gichoko chir dakika matin bang'e ma giduogo mi gibayo nyang'no gi kite sama nyang' nogo abal molal ei pi.

eng: The fishermen later swam to safety at Dunga beach where they reported the incident to the locals and Kenya Wildlife Service(KWS) personnel who dashed to the scene in search of the body.
luo: Jolupogo ne ogoyo abal ka gidhi e dho wath Dunga kama ne ginyisoe ji gima otimore kendo fwaro joma tiyo gi Kenya Wildlife Service (KWS) mane oringo dhi manyo ringre ng'at mothono.

eng: This is the second time a crocodile has attacked a fisherman in the lake in less than a month and more intriguingly from the same family.
luo: Dwe pok orumo to ema nyang' osemako ji ariyo malupo e nam to gimiwuoro en ni giduto giwuok e ot achiel.

eng: According to the deceased sister Caroline Owuor Oduogo, just two weeks ago, one of her brothers Nick Owino Oduogo was attacked by a crocodile while on a fishing expedition.
luo: Caroline Owuor Oduogo ma en nyamin jal mothono, wacho ni mana jumbe ariyo mokalo, achiel kuom owetene miluongo ni Nick Owino Oduogo nyang' ne omako sama nolupo.

eng: Owino luckily escaped with injuries after the crocodile attacked him while fishing in the lake in the broad daylight.
luo: Owino notony matin kohinyore bang' nyang' make kane olupo e nam odiechieng' alanga.

eng: His father Joseph Oduogo was at pains to come to terms with the tragedy.
luo: Wuon-gi ma iluongo ni Joseph Oduogo, pod nigi lit nikech masirano.

eng: He said he got the sad news while visiting Owino who suffered injuries on his leg and hand that were mauled by the reptile.
luo: Owacho ni noyud ripod no kane odhi limo Owino mane ohinyore e tiende kod lwete ma ne nyang' okayo.

eng: ''One of Owino's fingers was bitten as he struggled to free himself from the tight grip of the crocodile’s jaws and now again his brother has been killed by the reptile. Why does this happen to my family,'' he sobbed.
luo: Nowacho kama, "Achiel kuom lith lwet Owino nyang' ne okayo sama ne oyi mondo owuog e lekene (Nyang)' to koro sani kendo nyang' onego owadgi. Ang'o momiyo gigi timore ne jooda?"

eng: He recalled it was just by good luck that Owino's colleagues who were on the boat by then tying a rope responded by pelting the reptile head with huge stones and a panga.
luo: Owacho ni ne en gima ber ni jolupo mamoko ne ni machiegni ne obayo nyang'no gi kite kod ojala.

eng: The victim was rushed to Jaramogi Oginga Odinga Referral Hospital where he is undergoing treatment after his lucky escape as the search for Okoth's body continued.
luo: Ne oter Owino Jaramogi Oginga Odinga Referral Hospital kama idhi nyime thiedhe bang' tony ka ji pod dhi nyime manyo ringre owadgi.

eng: Owino's sister Owuor, said her brother was still writhing in pain in a hospital bed and had lost a lot of blood due to excessive bleeding from the mauled hand and leg.
luo: Nyamin Owino miluongo ni Owuor wacho ni owadgi ne nigi rem mang'eny e otanda mar osipital kendo nochuero remo mang'eny nikech nyang' ne okayo tiende kod lwete.

eng: "He needs three pints of blood because he bled a lot," said Owuor.
luo: Owuor nowacho kama, "Dwarore ni omede remo jwelni adek nikech nochuero remo mang'eny."

eng: County police commander Samwel Anampiu said he had deployed security personnel to control crowds building at the scene.
luo: Samwel Anampiu ma en komanda mar polis e kaonti wacho ni giseoro polise kuom oganda machokore kama nyang' nomekono.

eng: Dunga Beach Management Unit chair Joel Otieno blamed the attacks by crocodiles on an increase in fishing activities in the lake.
luo: Jakom mar buch Dunga Beach wacho ni nyang' medo mako ji nikech lupo ma medo timore e nam.

eng: wo men were on Thursday arrested in Migori while transporting bread alleged to be lighter than the industrially accepted weight.
luo: Ne omak chwo moko ariyo Tich Ang'wen Migori ka wachore ni giting'o makate ma kilo margi ok en ma opwodh.

eng: The suspects, a driver and a salesperson, were transporting the loaves of bread in 50 crates from a Kisii bakery.
luo: Achije ariyo go, ma en dereba gi jauso, ne oting'o makate e kret 50 ma giwuokgo e kambi maloso makate Kisii.

eng: The bread was to be supplied to shops and supermarkets in Migori Town.
luo: Ne gitero makatego e dukni kod dukni madongo mantie e taon mar Migori.

eng: Residents had filed complaints about the weight of bread they had been buying from local shops, stating the brand from the Kisii bakery was “notorious” for selling them low-weight bread.
luo: Jong'iepo osebedo ka ywagore ni makate ma ging'iewo e dukni tindo kendo ni makate miloso gi kambi man Kisii ohero loso makate matindo.

eng: The consumer protection department officers laid a trap with police and impounded the vehicle as soon as it arrived in Migori Town.
luo: Riwruok mar jong'iepo nowinjore gi polise ma giloso obadho e ndara kama ne gimakoe garino sama nodonjo e taon ma Migori.

eng: When 770 samples of the packaged loaves were weighed, the scale indicated that each loaf was 365 grams instead of the industrially-accepted 400 grams.
luo: Ne opim makate mopogore 770 kendo noyudore ni makatego duto kilo margi en gram 365 mopogore gi 400 kaka onego gibed.

eng: The inspector in charge of commercial goods weight in Migori, Tobias Nyakamo, told The Standard that the suspects will be charged with contravening Part Six of the Consumer Protection Act.
luo: Tobias Nyakamo, mae en Inspekta mochung'ne rango gik miuso gi joohala e Migori, nonyiso The Standard ni achijego ibiro donjnegi gi ketho mar timo gima opogore gi gima ma chik wacho e echike marito weche mag ngiewo, Auchiel mar Consumer Protection Act.

eng: The Ministry of Trade in Migori said it will conduct impromptu inspections to ensure goods sold to consumers meet the requisite standards.
luo: Migawo mar Ohala e Migori nowacho ni gibiro wuotho ma ok gichano e dukni mondo girang ka be gik miuso owinjore.

eng: The Consumer Protection Act allows the Consumer Protection Department to investigate complaints relating to false or misleading representations, unconscionable conduct as well as supply of unsafe, defective and unsuitable goods.
luo: Chik mar Consumer Protection Act oyiene Riwruok mar Jong'iepo mondo onon weche ma ji ywagorego ni jo uso wuondo ji gi gik ma gindiko kuom gik ma giuso kendo moko kuom gi gin gik ma owinjore kata nyalo hinyo ngima ng'ato.

eng: The Department also investigates undertakings that fail to comply with prescribed Consumer Product Safety Standards and prescribed Product Information Standards
luo: Riwruogno bende nono jo ohala ma luwo chike moket mondo orit ngima jong'iepo kod ma ok luw chike mag weche e wi Rang'iny mag gik Miuso.

eng: Consumers can complain directly to the Authority through Email, telephone call,s or walking into the Authority’s offices.
luo: Jong'iepo nyalo tero ywak margi achiel achiel ir joma nie migawono kokalo kuom ndiko email, goyo simo kata dhi aching' e ofise jogo.

eng: The consumer is required to fill in a consumer complaint form and provide all the relevant information concerning the complaint.
luo: Dwarorore ni jang'iepo ojas fom moro kendo ochiw weche duto e wi jauso ma odonjoneno.

eng: On receipt of a consumer complaint, the Consumer Protection Department will acknowledge receipt of the complaint and advise the consumer on any information gaps.
luo: Riwruok mar Jong'iepo bang' yudo fomno, gibiro wuoyo gi jausono kae to ginyise gimowinjore otim.

eng: Upon receipt of all the information from the complainant, the Authority shall analyse the complaint and contact the accused party for information if necessary.
luo: Migawono ka osewinjo ywak duto mag jang'iepono, gibiro nono wechego kae to gimanyo jausono mondo omedgi weche momedore ka dwarore.

eng: The Authority may then apply administrative remedies to solve the complaints which include: refund, replacement or repair of goods, withdrawal of misleading representations, recall of unsafe goods and notices to the public on the existence of such goods.
luo: Migawono nyalo konyo jang'iepono kokalo kuom: duokone pesa, wilone gima nong'iewo, golo weche mag miriambo e wi gik miuso, lando ne oganda ka nitie gik manyalo hinyogi ma ji uso.

eng: Complaints that do not fall under the Authority’s jurisdiction are referred to the relevant Government Agencies.
luo: Weche ma ok otudore gi Migawono imiyo ofise mowinjore mag Sirkal.

eng: Complaints that are not solved under the above arrangement are forwarded to the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions (ODPP) after the completion of full investigations.
luo: Weche ma otamogi loso ikowo e Ofis mar jatend sirikal ma ochung' ne yalo ji -  Director of Public Prosecutions (ODPP) bang' tieko nonro duto.

eng: Upon conviction, a person who contravenes the Part Six provisions of the Act is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 5 years or to a fine not exceeding Sh10 million or both.
luo: Ka bura oloyo ng'ato moyude gi ketho kaluwore gi Kare mar Auchiel  mar Chikno, ibiro tueye kuom higni ma ok kal abich kata chulo faini ma ok okadho milion apar.

eng: A miner has died and 300 families were displaced by floods following heavy rains that have hit Migori County.
luo: Jakunyo moro otho kendo joute 300 ne odar nikech kodh ohula maduong' machue e kaonti ma Migori.

eng: Most of those affected are from North Kadem ward in Nyatike sub-County. They are currently camping in schools and churches.
luo: Thoth jogo wuok e kar chung matin ma North Kadem Nyatike sab-kaonti. Sani gidak e skunde kod kanise.

eng: The victims said they have also lost property, including livestock, that was swept away by floods.
luo: Giwacho ni gilalo mwandu mang'eny moriwo jamni mane apaka oyweyo modhigo.

eng: West Kanyuor chief Philip Opolo said flooding got worse after Migori and Kuja rivers broke their banks, and expressed fears more people will be displaced.
luo: Philip Opolo ma en chif mar West Kanyuor wacho ni apaka ne omedore ka ne aora Migori kod aora Kuja omwomo kendo oluor ni ji mang'eny dhi medo dar.

eng: He said a gold miner, identified as George Oriedo, died on Monday evening after walls of a mine in Mikeyi collapsed on him.
luo: Owacho ni jakunyono mar dhahabu, miluongo ni George Oriedo ne otho chieng' Wuok Tich godhiambo ka ne kite opodhe kuome ei bur.

eng: Witnesses said Oriedo went into the mine soon after the rains had stopped then the accident happened.
luo: Joneno wacho ni Oriedo nodonjo e bur bang' ka koth nosechok eka masirano noyude.

eng: “The walls of the mine had been weakened by the water. They collapsed and he suffocated,” Jared Nyakie, a head teacher at Ndemra Primary School, said.
luo: Jared Nyakie ma en jatend Ndemra Primary School wacho niya, "Pi nomiyo sirni mag bugono bedo mayomyom. Ne gipodho motho nikech ne ok onyal yueyo."

eng: “The floods have affected livelihoods. We are appealing for relief food to feed those affected,” chief Opolo said.
luo: Chif Opolo nowacho kama, "Apakani oseketho tije ji mang'eny. Wakwayo mondo ji okonywa gi chiemo mwanyalo miyo joma oyudo masira."

eng: He added that the floods have not halted the construction works of a Sh1.7 billion road in the area.
luo: Nomedo wacho ni apaka ok osechungo tij gero ndara e alworano ma dhi kawo pesa maromo bilion 1.7.

eng: Engineers working on the 42-kilometre Masara-Sori road have however been forced to seek government approval to redesign a section of the road, around North Kadem ward, that is affected by the floods.
luo: Chuno ni injinia magero ndara mar kilomita 42 kiwuok Masara nyaka Sori okwa mondo sirkal opwodh goro manyien mar ndara e alwora mar North Kadem wod ma apaka oketho.

eng: Nyanza Regional Commissioner Magu Mutindika said 25 kilometres have been turned into bitumen standard road.
luo: Magu Mutindika ma en jatend sirikal ma malo e alwora mar Nyanza wacho ni kilomita 25 mag ndarono osego lam.

eng: The remaining 17 kilometres will form part of what would be redesigned.
luo: Kilomita 17 modong'  nie chenro migoro manyien.

eng: “The area has been affected by floods and this has forced the contractor and government engineers to seek approvals to redesign that part of the road,” Mutindika said.
luo: Mutindika wacho kama, "Apaka oketho alworano to mano osechuno ja ger ndara no kod injinia mag sirkal mondo okwa oyienegi goyo kwano manyien mar dhi loso ndarano."

eng: He said the redesigned road will see flood waters escape through culverts.
luo: Nowacho ni ndara molos manyien biro miyo pi apaka okal e olalo.

eng: “The works will include diversions and more gravelling in affected areas,” he said.
luo: Nowacho kama, "Tich mitimo oriwo goyo mtaro kod chueyo motegno gi kokoto kuonde mokethore."

eng: Two suspects charged with manslaughter in a case where a 10-storey building collapsed in Kisii killing eight people in November 2016 have been freed.
luo: Ogony achije ariyo ma ne odonj negi gi ketho mag nek e bura moro ma gorofa moro ne olwar Kisii monego ji aboro e dwe mar Novemba, 2016.

eng: Jeremiah Matoke and Jeff Ocharo faced eight counts of manslaughter.
luo: Jeremiah Matoke kod Jeff Ocharo ne odonjnegi gi ketho mar nego ji aboro.

eng: They were accused that on November 10, 2016, at Kisii Municipality block 111/236 in Kisii town, they unlawfully and negligently caused the deaths of the eight people.
luo: Ne odonjnegi ni tarik 10 Novemba, 2016, e ot mantie Kisii Municipality block namba 111/236, ji aboro ne otho nikech ne gijwang'o luwo chik moketi gi sirikal.

eng: Kisii Chief Magistrate Nathan Lutta noted that in a criminal case, the duty was always on the prosecution to prove its case against an accused beyond a reasonable doubt.
luo: Kisii Chief Magistrate Nathan Lutta nowacho ni sama odonjne ng'ato gi ketho moro amora, sirikal ema nigi ting' mar lero ma onge kiawa moro amora ni keth modonj negi go en adier.

eng: “From the evidence produced in court, it is not demonstrated that the said parcel belongs to the accused,” Lutta said.
luo: Lutta nowacho ni, "Ka luwore gi weche mochiwne kot, onge gimora amora manyiso ni mano ne en mwandu achich modonjne."

eng: Patrick Achoki, the County Director of Physical Planning, said an inspection on the collapsed building was done in September 2014.
luo: Patrick Achoki, ma en dairekta mochung'ne nono chenro mag gedo e kaonti, nowacho ni ot ma ne oruombore pinyno ne ne onon chal mare Septemba 2014.

eng: At the time, Achoki said they did not have a record of approved buildings. “We requested the owner to submit the plans, which were later approved.”
luo: Achoki wacho ni e kindeno ne gionge gi nyinge ute mosepwodh. Owacho kama, "Ne wakwayo wuon-go mondo omiwa goro mag utego kendo bang'e ne opwodhgi."

eng: The then National Construction Authority regional manager, Lucas Adwera, testified that they visited the site in July 2016 and found out that there was a lack of compliance and immediately issued a suspension notice.
luo: Lucas Adwera, ma ne ochung'ne  Migawo mar Gedo e Piny  e alworano, ne owacho ni ne gidhi kama igedeno dwe mar abiriyo 2016, kendo ne giyudo ka jogo ok oluwo chik omiyo ne gichungo gedo margi.

eng: The accused persons, however, denied the offences saying they were not the developers of the said property.
luo: Achije mane odonjnigo notamora kethogo ka giwacho ni ok gin e weg odno.

eng: With the ruling, the affected families will be forced to explore other means to get justice.
luo: Bura ma ne ong'adno biro chuno mondo joot mane oyudo masira omany yo machielo ma giyudogo bura makare.

eng: Burundi President to attend Madaraka Day celebrations
luo: Ker ma Burundi ikore biro e nyasi mar Madaraka Day

eng: Burundi President Evariste Ndayishimiye will jet into the country on Monday, May 31 to attend Tuesday’s Madaraka Day celebrations.
luo: Ker ma Burundi, Evariste Ndayishimiye dhi biro Kenya chieng' Wuok Tich tarik 31 Mei mondo obed e nyasi mar Madaraka ma dhi timore Tich Ariyo.

eng: According to sources within the government, President Ndayishimiye might be the only foreign Head of State to grace the ceremony, which will be held in Kisumu County.
luo: Kaluwore gi jomoko matiyo e sirkal, wachore ni samoro Ker Ndayishimiye e ker kende moa oko madhi biro e nyasi madhi timore Kisumu.

eng: East African Community (EAC) recently named President Ndayishimiye as rapporteur while President Kenyatta was chosen as the community’s chairperson.
luo: Riwruok mar East African Community (EAC) nyocha oketo Ker Ndayishimiye obedo itgi kod dhoggi to Ker Kenyatta ne oyier obed jakom.

eng: In June 2020, President Kenyatta congratulated Ndayishimiye on his election as President and pledged to work with him, saying Burundi was Kenya’s valued development partner.
luo: E higa mar 2020 dwe mar auchil, Ker Kenyatta ne opwoyo Ndayishimiye ka oyiero obedo Ker kendo ne osingore ni odhi tiyo kode kowacho ni Burundi en osiep Kenya e timo gik makelo dongruok.

eng: The visit comes after a similar one to Uganda on May 13 to woo Ugandan investors to invest in Burundi.
luo: Noyudo oselimo piny Uganda tarik 13 dwe mar abich wuoyo gi jo ohala man Uganda mondo otim ohala gi piny Burundi.

eng: This year’s Madaraka Day celebrations will be an invite-only event as part of the Covid-19 measures.
luo: Jogo madhi betie e nyasi mar Madaraka mitimo higani gin mana joma ogwel kende nikech chike mag Covid-19.

eng: Kisumu Governor Anyang’ Nyong’o said only 3,000 guests have been invited to attend the celebrations.
luo: Gavana ma Kisumu, Anyang' Nyong'o nowacho ni ogwel welo 3,000 kende mondo odhi e nyasino.

eng: “Jomo Kenyatta International Stadium can accommodate 35,000 people, however, we have only invited 3,000 which is about 10 per cent of the entire capacity. This is in line with the Covid-19 protocols,” said Governor Nyong’o.
luo: Gavana Nyong'o nowacho kama, "Jomo Kenyatta International Stadium nyalo ting'o ji 35,000, kata kamano, wagwelo mana ji 3,000 ma en chiegni pasent apar mar kwan duto. Ma en ka luwore gi chike mag Covid-19."

eng: This is the first time Kisumu will host a national ceremony.
luo: Ma e kinde mokwongo ma Kisumu ohangoe bedo kama itimoe nyasi mokwako piny.

eng: Previously, the holidays were presided over in Nairobi until the Jubilee regime revised the trend to rotate the celebrations in counties.
luo: E kinde mokalo, nyasi kaka mago ne itimoga Nairobi kata kamano, sirkand Jubilee ne oloko mondo kama itomoe nyasino olworre e kaonti mopogore opogore.

eng: Madaraka Day is celebrated every year on June 1 to commemorate the day Kenya attained internal self-rule in 1963 after colonisation from Britain.
luo: Nyasi mar Madaraka itimoga higa ka higa tarik 1 dwe mar auchiel ka iparogo odiechieng' ma Kenya nochako bedo gi loch margi giwegi e higa mar 1963 bang' bedo e bwo loch jo Britain.

eng: Rescue efforts on following collapse of county building in Nyamira
luo: Kinda mar reso joma ot oruombore kuomgi Nyamira

eng: Rescuers were last evening working against time to find survivors after the collapse of a Nyamira County Assembly building that was under construction.
luo: Nyoro godhiambo ne ji pod manyo joma otony bang' ka ot ma ne pod igero ruombore piny, ot ma dhi bedo Od Bura mar Kaonti ma Nyamira.

eng: By 6.30pm, 25 workers out of 35 that were working at the site before it came tumbling down had been rescued.
luo: Ka ne ochopo sa apar gariyo gi nus odhiambo, ne oseres jotich 25 kuom 35 mane tiyo kanyo kane odno pok oruombore piny.

eng: The building at the county assembly collapsed minutes past 5pm.
luo: Odno mantie kama od bura mar kaonti nitie ne oruombore piny dakika matin tok sa apar gachiel.

eng: Nyamira County Commissioner Gikaro Mariba told The Standard on phone that authorities were doing all they could to rescue those trapped.
luo: Jatend sirikal ma malo ma Nyamira (County Commissioner) Gikaro Mariba ne onyiso The Standard e simo ni gitemo kar nyalogi mondo gires ji duto momoko.

eng: "The rescue mission is ongoing. Locals and a combined team of government rescuers are on site to help those trapped," Mariba said.
luo: Mariba nowacho niya, "Chenro mar reso ji dhi nyime. Raia kod jo sirkal ni kama ot nopodhoe mondo gikony joma pod omoko."

eng: The staircase to the four-storey building collapsed as the workers prepared to leave the site after the day's work.
luo: Ngas ma ihidho go odno ne olwar sama jotich ne ikore mar wuok bang' tieko tijgi ma odiechieng'no.

eng: The main road in Kitutu Masaba constituency has for a long time been used as a political carrot to woo locals into voting for politicians who pledge to tarmac it.
luo: Ndara maduong mantie Kitutu Masaba osetigo nyading'eny gi josiasa ka gitemo sero ji ogonegi ombulu mondo gigo ndarano lam.

eng: For over three decades, the Amabuko-Rigoma-Magombo-Kemera road has made and unmade politicians, as many have used it as a campaign tool.
luo: Kuom higni mang'eny, ndara mar Amabuko-Rigoma-Magomba-Kemera osemiyo josiasa oyudo loch to moko opodho nikech gitiyo kode e timo kampen.

eng: Nearly all the MPs who have been elected from Kitutu Masaba have pledged to have the road tarmacked from Kemera town, where it connects with the Kisii-Nyamira-Chemosit road to Amabuko shopping centre where it joins the Kisii-Keroka-Sotik-Nairobi highway.
luo: Chiegni ni Jood Bura duto moseyier Kitutu Masaba osega singore ni gidhi goyo ndarano lam kowuok taon mar Kemera kama oromoe gi ndara mar Kisii-Nyamira-Chemosit modhi nyaka chiro mar Amabuko ma orade gi ndara maduong' mar Kisii-Keroka-Sotik-Nairobi.

eng: It is not only MPs who have used the road as a political tool to win votes from residents; other leaders who have been eyeing other political seats have also used it.
luo: To ok en Jood Bura kende ema osekampen ka gitiyo gi ndarano mondo ji ogonegi ombulu, nitie jotelo mamoko ma be osetiyo kode.

eng: The late President Daniel Moi, retired President Mwai Kibaki and President Uhuru Kenyatta all used it as a campaign tool.
luo: Ker mane osetho Daniel Moi, Ker machon Mwai Kibaki kod Ker Uhuru Kenyatta notiyo gi wach loso ndarano e kampen ma ne gitimo.

eng: During Moi’s era, the road was marked for upgrading to bitumen standard but this did not happen because of the political winds of the time. Former area MP, the late George Anyona, became a fierce critic of Moi.
luo: E ndalo Moi, ne osechan ni idhi go ndarano lam, kata kamano, mano ne ok otimore ka luwore gi weche siasa ma ne nitie e ndalono. Jaod Bura machon mosenindo George Anyano ne kwedo mager loch Moi.

eng: At one time, Anyona had promised to repair the road but because of lack of political goodwill from the government, that did not happen.
luo: Nitie kinde moro ma Anyona ne owacho ni odhi loso ndarano, kata kamano, nikech ok owinjre gi sirkal ne ok omiye pesa.

eng: President Kibaki also pledged to have it finished around 2010, but the road was never upgraded.
luo: Ker Kibaki be nowacho ni ne odhi tieko loso ndarano e higa mar 2010, to mano ne ok otimore.

eng: Having the road tarmacked remained a pipe dream until 2013 when the work began.
luo: Goyo ndarano lam ne obed lek nyaka e higa mar 2013 ka ne tij lose ochakore.

eng: Uhuru and his Deputy William Ruto, while campaigning in 2013 ahead of the General Election, also earmarked the project for construction.
luo: Uhuru kod Jalupne William Ruto ka ne gitimo kampen 2013 ka yiero pok ochopo, ne giwacho ni gidhi loso ndarano.

eng: And in 2017, construction works on the road stalled at Gekano Tea Buying Centre after the contractor terminated the works.
luo: E higa mar 2017, tij gero ndarano ne ochung' gi alwora mar Gekano Tea Buying Centre bang' ka ngama ne omi orak mar lose weyo tich.

eng: The other section near River Gucha bridge and a 15-kilometre stretch remain incomplete.
luo: Kuonde ma ne odong' ma ok otiek los e ndarano gin alwora man machiegni gi olalo mar Aora Gucha kod kama romo kilomita 15.

eng: Area MP Shadrack Mose has been fighting to have the road completed before his term expires. His plan seems to succeed as a contractor is already the site to do the job.
luo: Jaod Bura makanyo Shadrack Mose osebedo kakedo matek mondo otiek loso ndarano ka pok owuok e loch. Chenroneno dhi ka tiyo nikech nitie jagedo ma osechako tij loso ndarano.

eng: Currently, survey works are being carried out by a Chinese company, which was given the contract.
luo: Tij survey e ndarano ne omi kambi moro mar Jo-China.

eng: “This is a very important road, which no one can ignore. Tea farmers in the area have faced difficulties in transporting their produce to the factories because of the poor state of the road. Such challenges will soon be a thing of the past,” Mose said.
luo: Mose nowacho kama, "Ma ndara maduong' ma ok onego ojwang'. Jopur ma odak e alworani chandore gi kaka ginyalo kowegi gik ma gikayo e kembe nikech ndara rach. Machiegnini, chandruogego biro rumo."

eng: Residents say completion of the road will give the area MP an upper hand in the 2022 polls.
luo: Jodak wacho ni ka otiek loso ndarano to mano biro konyo Jaod Burano e yiero mar 2022.

eng: “Mose will have higher chances of re-election if he pushes the government to finish the project before next year,” said Peter Mokua, a resident of Gekano.
luo: Peter Mokua modak Gekano, wacho kama, "Ka Mose okaso sirkal motieko loso ndarani ka higa manyien pok ochopo, mano nyalo miyo oyiere kendo."

eng: Oscars pushed back to April 2021 as film industry scrambles to adapt amid coronavirus
luo: Mich mag Oscar ochwal nyaka April 2021 sama kembe maloso sinema pod nyagore gi tich e kinde tuo corona

eng: Film's most prestigious award has had to be postponed after the industry took a major blow amid coronavirus.
luo: Ne ochuno mondo ochor Mich mag Oscar bang' ka josinembe noromo gi chandruoge mang'eny nikech corona.

eng: The Oscars ceremony for 2021 has been shifted back by nearly two months after the majority of films since March this year had to be put on hold.
luo: Nyasi mag chiwo mich Oscar e higa mar 2021 ne olok tarige gi dweche ariyo bang' ka thoth sinembe ma chakore Mach higani ne ochung.

eng: It has been moved from a February 28th to an April 25th date.This move should accommodate early 2021 releases, delayed because of the pandemic.
luo: Tarik owil kowuok e 28 dwe mar ariyo modhi tarik 25 dwe mar agwen. Mano dhi konyo sinembe mane ogol chak higani nikech tuo mar corona.

eng: President of the Academy, David Rubin, and CEO Dawn Hudson, said of their decision: “For over a century, movies have played an important role in comforting, inspiring and entertaining us during the darkest of times.
luo: Ker mar Akedemino, David Rubin kod CEO Dawn Hudson, nowacho kama, "Kuom higni mokalo mia achiel, sinembe osekonyo ahinya e hoyo, jiwo kendo moro chuny ji sama weche tek.

eng: "Our hope, in extending the eligibility period and our awards date, is to provide the flexibility filmmakers need to finish and release their films without being penalized for something beyond anyone's control."
luo: Dwarowa maduong' sama wachoro nyime tarik mar chiwo mich, en ni mondo okony jolos sinema obed gi thuolo moromo mar tieko loso sinembegi ma ok gogi fain ne gima onge kaka ne ginyalo timo."

eng: The new date’s means nominations will be announced on March 15th 2021, with the submission deadline for general entry categories (which includes Best Picture) on January 15th.
luo: Tarik manyien mochiwno nyiso ni ibiro yier jopiem tarik 15 Mach, 2021, to tarik mogik ma gibiro kawoe nyinge joma piem ne mich (moriwo mich Picha Maber) biro bedo Januar 15.

eng: It is yet another blow to music fans as Kenya mourns popular Benga artiste Erick Omondi who died of cancer in Bondo, Siaya County on Tuesday morning.
luo: Jo-Kenya nigi kuyo mang'eny kendo nikech jathum machielo mar Benga otho, miluongo ni Erick Omondi. Kansa onege Tich Ariyo okinyi Bondo, Siaya Kaonti.

eng: The death of the ex-member of the legendary Nabi Kings Band popularly referred to by his fans as "Long Lilo" has gutted his fans.
luo: Tho mar jathum ma chon ni e grup miluongo ni Nabi Kings Band ma ne ong'ere gi nying mar "Long' Lilo" oweyo ji kuyo.

eng: The 37-year-old father of three died at 4:30 am while undergoing treatment at Bondo Sub-County Hospital.
luo: Nojahigni 37 kendo ne en gi nyithindo adek. Notho kar sa apar gi nus okinyi e kama nithiedhe e Bondo Sub-County Hospital.

eng: His wife Goretty Awino and family spokesperson Olima Gondi confirmed the death.
luo: Chiege, Goretty Awino kod Olima Gondi mawuoyo e lo-gi ema nowacho ripod thone.

eng: Long Lilo thrilled his fans with his husky voice and engaging lyrics during his prime days when he sang alongside Osito Kalle, another legendary Luo Benga icon who trained him.
luo: Long' Lilo ne moro chuny joherane gi dwonde mamit kod kaka nower ndalo mane ower kanyachiel gi Osito Kalile, ma be Ja-Benga mong'ere kendo ma ne otiege.

eng: Some of his hit songs include Goretti Awino, Were wuod Ogalo, Okoth Mang’ang’a, Kong’o shida, Anita Nyausonga , Thomas Mwaya and any more. In his song Japuonj, Omondi praises Osito Kalle for his ability to nurture other singers like himself, Odhiambo Tusker, Aluoch Pamba, Atommy Sifa, Ogina Koko (currently Ramogi FM presenter) and many others.
luo: Moko kuom wendege mong'ere gin Goretti Awino, Were wuod Ogalo, Okoth Mang'ang'a, Kong'o shida, Anita Nyausonga, Thomas Mwaya kod mamoko mang'eny. E wer miluongo ni Japuonj, Omondi pako Osito Kalile nikech nokonye kod jower mamoko kaka Odhiambo Tusker, Aluoch Pamba, Atommy Sifa, Ogina Koko (ma sani en jalendo e redio) kod jomamoko mang'eny.

eng: Odhiambo Tusker after graduating from the hands of Osito composed a hit song Jopuonj, a piece which praised the efforts of teachers in the society and received widespread acclamation among the Luo fan base.
luo: Odhiambo Tusker bang' tieko tiegruok e lwet Osito, ne owero wer mong'ere ni Jopuonj, wendno ne opwoyo kinda ma jopuonje timo kendo ji mang'eny nohero werno e joherana ma Joluo.

eng: Osito who mentored them also starred with other songs such as Lesna buoyo ma wiye, Asembo piny maber, Jaber jaula and much more.
luo: Osito ma ne opuonjo gino en be nowero wende kaka Lesna Bwoyo ma Wiye, Asembo Piny Maber, Jaber Jaula kod mamoko.

eng: Long’Lilo was reportedly ill with cancer for a long time and at some point was appealing for medical help.
luo: Kansa ne osebedo ka tuoyo Long' Lilo kuom kinde malach ma kata nitie ndalo moro ma ne okwayo mondo ji okonye.

eng: His death comes barely a week after Luo Ohangal fans were shocked with the sudden death of Abenny Jachiga who died in Kisumu abruptly and was buried with less than 48 yours against the wishes of his fans.
luo: Tho mare otimore ka kata juma achiel ema pok orumo are Joluo mohero Ohangla winj ni Abenny Jachiga otho apoya nono Kisumu kendo noyike mapiyo gi seche 48 mopogore gi dwach joherane.

eng: Nothing shakes the conscience of mankind than an unexplained death of a celebrity.
luo: Onge gima chandoga chuny oganda moloyo tho apoya mar ng'at ma nigi huma.

eng: Ken Walibora was not your ordinary celebrity pushed to fame by benevolent spirits.
luo: Ken Walibora ne en ng'at ma nigi huma nikech weche mopogore.

eng: At the time of his death, he was one of the most celebrated Swahili writers in Kenya and one of the universally acclaimed authors.
luo: Ne otho ka en achiel kuom jondiko mong'ere mag buge Kiswahili to bende nomiye luor kaka jandiko e piny ngima.

eng: Lovers of literature are pained not just by his death but the brutal manner in which it came.
luo: Jogo mohero somo buge winjo marach ahinya nikech tho mare kod kaka notho malit.

eng: Such death is reserved for troublesome characters in literary works.
luo: Thoye ma kamago yudorega mana e buge kiwuoyo kuom joma ne ok beyo.

eng: In such extra ordinary circumstances, the people of Khabondi would seek solace in the emotive Luhya dirge “Olumbe luno toto lwakhabere lurungungwa, mana lukhaya khwira, ndakhaluwere ing’ombe!” translated to mean “If death could be paid to spare someone, I would have given death a cow”.
luo: Sama weche kaka mano otimore, Jo-Luhya nigi wer moro ma wacho kama, “Olumbe luno toto lwakhabere lurungungwa, mana lukhaya khwira, ndakhaluwere ing’ombe!” ma tiende kolok en "Ka dine inyalo chul tho mondo owe ng'ato, dine amiyo tho dhiang'."

eng: Admittedly, I have never physically met Walibora.
luo: An ne pok aromo gi Walibora wang' gi wang'.

eng: I first knew him in Standard Seven in primary school when my Kiswahili teacher Peter Busolo insisted that I read Siku Njema and explain the synopsis to him in seven days.
luo: Nakwongo winjo nyinge ka an e klas abiriyo e kinde mane japuonjna mar Kiswahili nochika ni asom bug 'Siku Njema' kae to alerne gima bugno wuoye bang' odiechienge abiriyo.

eng: By that time, Siku Njema was a compulsory Kiswahili set book in secondary school, but here was a village-bred juvenile being asked to interpret it.
luo: Ndalono, bug Siku Njema ne isomo e sekondari kata kamano, an to ne pod an nyathi primary to ema inyisa ni asom bugno.

eng: Mr Busolo understood the kind of books that would inspire students’ passion.
luo: Mr Busolo ne ong'eyo buge mane nyalo miyo nyithindo oher somo.

eng: That was the last time he asked me to read any of Walibora’s books.
luo: Mano e kinde mogik ma ne okwaya mondo asom buge Walibora.

eng: I took it upon myself to monitor the author’s publications and read them.
luo: Bang'e, nachako manyo buge mamoko mag Walibora mondo asom.

eng: Walibora was a gifted story teller who understood an African village with magic.
luo: Walibora ne ong'eyo gano sigana mamit kendo nong'eyo timbe Jo Afrika.

eng: Our continuous interaction has been through his works.
luo: Wang'eye mana kokalo kuom buge mondiko.

eng: His characters lived among us.
luo: Ne chalo mana ka gima wadak gi joma wuoyo e bugene.

eng: Walibora wrote about things that we could see in our daily lives as students. Most of his characters were an inspiration.
luo: Joma Walibora ne ondiko e bugene ne gin joma waneno e ngimawa mapile kaka jopuonjre. Thoth jogo ne jiwowaga.

eng: I drew quite a number of lessons from Walibora’s works that have guided me to date.
luo: Nitie puonj mang'eny ma ne ayudo e buge Walibora mosetayo ngimana nyaka sani.

eng: In his master piece Siku Njema, Walibora demystifies the long held African concept of illegitimate children with a single phrase “Mwanaharamu hamna, kitendo ndicho cha haramu” to mean “there is no illegitimate child, it is the act that is illegitimate”.
luo: E buk mane ondiko mong'ere ni Siku Njema, Walibora nokwedo paro monya ma ji nigo e wi nyithindo ma minasi kowacho kama, “Mwanaharamu hamna, kitendo ndicho cha haramu” ma tiende en, "Onge nyathi ma ok owinjore onyuol, tim miyudego ema ok owinjore."

eng: Walibora’s main character in Siku Njema, Msanifu Kombo happens to be such a child. Through him, we are exposed to traumatising experiences that single mothers and their children go through.
luo: Jal miwuoyo kuome ahinya e Siku Njema iluongo ni Msanifu Kombo kende en be ne nyathi ma ne onyuol kamano. Kokalo kuom sigande, ileronwa chandruoge ma mine modak kendgi kaloe kod nyithindgi.

eng: The contempt with which society treats such children, and above all, their determination to succeed amid such challenges.
luo: Ileronwa bende kaka joma odak e alwora kwedoga nyithindo ma kamago kod kaka nyithindogo nyagore.

eng: Perhaps it is because of his humble upbringing or the strict Christian upbringing under Jehova’s Witness denomination.
luo: Nyalo bedo ni gima konyo Walibora ndiko buge mabeyo kamano en nikech nopon e od joma oluoro Nyasaye e din mar Jehovah's Witness kata Joneno mag Jehova.

eng: In my teaching of Children Law, I have found myself citing Walibora more than any other literary scholar.
luo: Asefwenyo ni ahero wacho weche ma ne Walibora owacho moloyo jondiko mamoko sama apuonjo Chik mar Nyithindo.

eng: His contribution to jurisprudence cannot be gainsaid.
luo: Walibora nokonyo ahinya e weche Chik.

eng: As a lawyer, I draw inspiration from Walibora’s book Kufa Kuzikana, translated by Prof Egara Kabaji et al as “Friends for Life”.
luo: An okil, kendo ahero ahinya somo buk mane Walibora ondiko miluongo ni "Kufa Kuzikana" ma Profesa Egara Kabaji oloko ni "Osiepe ma Ngita gi Del."

eng: In this text, a litigant who has made several trips to a lawyer’s office to claim money paid to the lawyer by an insurance company after an accident eventually commits suicide when the lawyer becomes uncooperative.
luo: E bugno, iwuoyo kuom ng'at moro ma ne odere nikech ne odhi e ofis okil mondo omiye pesa mar insurance bang' yudo hinyruok to okil notamore.

eng: The mastery of African idioms runs through his works.
luo: Bugene mang'eny opong' gi ngeche mag Jo-Afrika.

eng: Such lawyers within the legal circles are known as ambulance chasers. They exist in every corner of this country; taking advantage of victims of accidents to mint millions of shillings.
luo: Okinde kaka mago iluongo ni joma lawo geche mating'o jotuo. Giyudore kamora amora e pinyni, kendo gihero tiyo gi thuolo moneno sama aksident otimore mondo giyudo pesa mang'eny.

eng: My prayer is that the fate of Walibora’s characters will not befall him in death.
luo: Lamona en ni tho Walibora kik ochal gi mag joma ondiko e bugene.

eng: In such a society as ours, it calls for the courage and sobriety of men like Walibora to expose the social evils bedeviling mankind.
luo: E kindewagi, dwaro ni ng'ato ni obed gi chir kaka Walibora mondo onyeny e lela gik maricho matimore.

eng: The social pretense, political expediency and economic marginalisation are some of the things that informed Walibora’s works.
luo: Moko kuom gik miwuoyoe e buge Walibora oriwo wuodruok ma ji nigo, wuondruok mag josiasa kod mibadhi e weche pesa.

eng: The simplicity with which he told complex stories reveals the character of a man who was attached to society.
luo: Nohera ahinya ji to mano nenore gi kaka nolero mayot sigendni mogajore.

eng: The soils will consume the finest brains of our land.
luo: Jomariek tho rumo.

eng: Literature can be very predictive. Many things that Walibora wrote about have come to pass.
luo: Seche moko buge nyalo koro gik madhi timore. Thoth gik ma Walibora nondiko osetimore.

eng: His death and burial resemble that of the characters he wrote about.
luo: Thone kod kaka noyike chalo gi mag joma ne ondiko e bugene.

eng: In William Shakespeare’s words, my heart is in that grave where Walibora’s remains are being preserved.
luo: Katiyo weche ma William Shakespear nowacho, chunya nie bur kama okanie ringre Walibora.

eng: Blessed are the soils of that quiet village in Cherangany, where Walibora was laid to rest.
luo: Lowo mane oyikie Walibora en gweng' mar Cherengany en kama oguedhi.

eng: To your fans, we shall remain friends wa Kufa Kuzikana as we wait for that Siku Njema that we shall join you wherever you are!
luo: Ne johera mag Ken Walibora, wabiro siko ka wan osiepe ma Kufa Kuzikana ka warito Siku Njema ma wabiro romoe gi Walibora kendo.

eng: May his soul rest in peace.
luo: Mad chunye obed kama okuwe.

eng: Hyrax Hills National Museum, one of Kenya’s critical archaeological sites and a national monument is marking 100 years of existence this month.
luo: Hyrax Hills National Museum, ma oting'o gige machon mag Kenya, timo e dweni nyasi mar paro betie margi kuom higni 100.

eng: The famous archaeological site which has since placed Kenya as home of Early Man opened its doors in 1920, to host rich history and has since inspired history and geography lessons in schools.
luo: Kama ong'ereno moting'o gik machon miyo ikwano Kenya kaka kama dhano mokwongo ne okwongo dakie, ne oyaw e higa mar 1920 kendo osekonyo e puonjo histori kod jografi e skunde.

eng: The museum was declared a national monument in 1945, but opened its doors to the public in 1965.
luo: Museumno ne oland kaka mwandu sirkal e higa mar 1945, kata kamano ne oyiene ji chako donjoe e higa mar 1965.

eng: “This month marks 100 years of existence of this archaeological site that is just another classroom for thousands of learners across the country who visit,” Lilian Amwada, the museum’s curator said.
luo: Lilian Amwanda, mochung' ne museumno, wacho kama, "E dweni kae biro rwako higni 100 kendo osebedo kaka klas ne jopuonjre alufe e piny mabiroga limbe."

eng: And while the museum has been a source of knowledge on early humans, the number of visitors touring the site has been low, a move which has also seen a raft of initiatives in place to boost the numbers.
luo: Kata obedo ni museumno osebedo ka konyo ji ng'eyo weche e wi joma chon, jok ma biro limbe kanyo kwan margi osebedo ka dok chien to mano osemiyo olos chenro moko mondo otem ywayo ji momedore obi olim kanyo.

eng: “We have carried out renovations and also initiated talent programmes for children in a bid to make the young learners visit the museum more for key lessons,” Ms Amwada said.
luo: Amwanda nowacho kama, "Waloso kuonde mokethore kendo wachako timo piem mag talent ne nyithindo mondo mano oywagi gibi gipuonjre weche momedore."

eng: Hyrax, is part of the part of the critical, geologically rich areas in Rift Valley that provides tales of  historical footprints left behind by Early Man.
luo: Hyrax en achiel kuom kuonde mayudore Rift Valley machiwo puonj e wi ngima dhano makwongo e histori.

eng: It also boasts of a rich history of volcanic activities and information on the formation of the Rift Valley.
luo: Oting'o bende histori ma nyalilanda e wi gik mane otimore e gode man kuno kod kaka Rift Valley ne olosore.

eng: The site, is also part of patches of archaeological sites that makes Kenya and especially the Rift Valley a hotbed of archaeological discoveries alongside Kariandusi Archeological site in Gilgil.
luo: Hyrax en achiel kuom kuonde mang'eny moting'o gige machon mamiyo Kenya to ahinya ahinya Rift Valley kod Kariandusi, Gilgil bedo kuonde moting'o weche mathoth e ngima machon.

eng: Particularly, Hyrax hills museum is named after hyraxes that lived in the rocks within and is famous for keeping the history of Sirikwa people who are believed to have been assimilated with the Maasai community.
luo: Museum mantie Hyrax hills ne omi nyingno bang' gik miluongo ni hyrax ma ne odak e kite madongo kendo kanyo ong'ere nikech oting'o histori mar Jo-Sirikwa ma wachore ni ne olokore mobedo Maasai.

eng: The museum, has since been an archaeological research area and reference point for pre-historical investigations.
luo: Jogo ma dwaro timo nonro e wi gik mane otimore chon ahinya e ngima dhano dhiga e museumno.

eng: It is also believed to be the first Acheulian site to be discovered in the region.
luo: Wachore bende ni kanyo ema nokwong yudie gik ma dhano mokwongo ne tiyogo e loso gik moko.

eng: Records from the museum however reveal low visitation despite the critical role in education sector with the bulk of visitors being learners.
luo: Rekod mag museumno nyiso ni kwan mag welo ma limo kanyo tin kata obedo ni migawo mar somo temo matek mondo ong'ere kendo joma dhiga kanyo thothgi gin jopuonjre.

eng: In 2016, Hyrax Hills National Museum recorded 21,781 visitors of whom 17,667 were learners from primary, secondary and institutions of higher learning.
luo: E higa mar 2016,  Hyrax Hills National Museum nowacho ni ne giyudo welo maromo 21,781 to ji 17,667 kuomgi ne gin jopuonjre mag skund primary, sekondar kod kuonde somo mamalo.

eng: In 2018, the museum generated Sh1.6 million while in 2019, total revenues amounted Sh1.7 million.
luo: E higa mar 2018, museumno ne oyudo pesa maromo siling milion 1.6 to e higa mar 2019, ne pesa duto ma gin go ne en siling milion 1.7.

eng: The same year, the museum generated Sh1.8 million and the following year, the revenues dropped slightly to Sh1.6 million with over 23,000 visitors making to the museum.
luo: E higa achielno, museum noyudo milion 1.8 to e higa ma ne oluwo, pesa manochok nodok chien nyaka milion 1.6 ka welo ma ne olimo museum kwan margi ne okalo 23,000.

eng: Primary and secondary school learners mostly visit the museum with records showing that 12,169 learners from primary and secondary school visited the museum.
luo: Jo primary kod jopuonjre sekondary ema thothne limo museum rekod nyiso ni kwan mar jopuonjrego ne ochopo 12,169.

eng: 5,498 students from colleges and universities visited the museum the same year.
luo: E higano bende, jopuonjre mag kolej kod yunivasiti ma ne olimo museumno kwan margi ne ochopo 5,498.

eng: Locals visiting the museum are mostly couples visiting for nature trails.
luo: Jo-Kenya mamoko ma limo museumno thothgi gin jomokendore ma obiro bayo.

eng: With charges as low as Sh100 for an adult local citizen and Sh50 for a child charged in these sites, locals still miss out with visitors barely making to 30,000 in a year.
luo: Pesa midonjogo tin nikech jomadongo chulo siling 100 to nyithindo chulo 50, to ema pod Jo-Kenya mang'eny ok bi ka kwan-gi tekga mondo ochop ji 30,000 e higa.

eng: The Hyrax hills was proclaimed a national monument in 1945 and opened to public in 1965 but despite the significance it has, it has lost two and a half acres of its over 50 acres of land to squatters.
luo: Hyrax hills ne oland kaka mwandu sirkal e higa mar 1945, kata kamano ne oyiene ji chako donjoe e higa mar 1965, to kata obedo ni en kaka lich kamano, oselalo lowo maromo eka ariyo gi nus ne jodak kuom eka 50 ma en go.

eng: According to the National Lands Commission Nakuru County coordinator Frank Kimbelekenya, part of the land has been grabbed.
luo: Ka luwore gi Frank Kimbelekenya ma en jachan bura mar National Lands Commission e kaonti mar Nakuru, ne owacho ni jodak okawo gi thuon lop museum.

eng: Covid-19 has given a new lease of life to an old song about social distancing.
luo: Covid-19 ochiero wer moro machon ma ne wuoyo e bedo mabor gi wadu.

eng: Micah Maritim (pictured) the singer who composed the song 18 years ago, is also basking in new-found glory.
luo: Micah Maritim (monyis e picha) e jawer mane ondiko werno higni 18 mokalo kendo sani humbe landore.

eng: In the 10-minute song, Maritim warns about a certain incurable disease, urging his listeners to literally run to the hills for safety.
luo: E wer makawo dakika aparno, Maritim chiwo siem e wi tuo moro ma onge yadhe, kendo ojiwo jowinjo mondo oring odhi e gode giyud resruok.

eng: “Don’t let anyone touch you/ even when you are in bed sleeping/ Don’t brush shoulders with anyone even when you are walking around/ Don’t shake hands with anyone; and why should you? do you know that the person has come from or touched....?” Goes part of the chorus.
luo: Bath koras mar wendno wacho kama, "Kik iwe nga'to omuli/ kata sama inindo e otanda; Kik ituomri gi ng'ato ang'ata sama iwuotho; Kik imos lwet ng'ato; ang'o momiyo idwa mose? Be ing'eyo kama ng'atno oaye kota omulo…?"

eng: The 62-year-old singer from Bomet County is known for his social commentary.
luo: Jawerno ma sani jahigni 62 kendo owuok e kaonti mar Bomet bende ong'ere gi weche mojawachoga.

eng: He said he composed the uncharacteristically lengthy song in 2002.
luo: Owacho ni ondiko wer ma rarieyano e higa mar 2002.

eng: “At the time, I was in Eldoret and television channels were awash with reports of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) which had broken out in China and was spreading to other countries,” Maritim said.
luo: Maritim wacho kama, "E kindeno, nadak Eldoret kendo nilando e tv ripode mag tuo miluongo ni Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) mane omouch China kendo landore e pinje mamoko."

eng: “From the scary news clip I saw medics in protective gear attending to patients, and outside, police officers were chasing people off the streets. It was then that I decided to compose a song about this phenomenon.”
luo: Odhi nyime wacho kama, "Pichni ma ne anenogo ne nyalo bwogo ng'ato kendo naneno laktech kobawore gi lewni moumo dendgi duto sama githietho jotuo, to polise ne riembo ji odog e utegi. Mano e ma nomiyo andiko wendno."

eng: He says that he did not even sit down to write lyrics to the song titled “SARS”.
luo: Owacho ni ne ok obet piny mondo ondik weche wer miluongo ni "SARS".

eng: Maritim started singing in 1981 and has a repertoire of over 100.
luo: Maritim ne ochako wer e higa mar 1981 kendo osewero wende mokalo 100.

eng: He says he just entered the studio and “went with the flow”.
luo: Owacho ni nodojo e studio to ochako mana wero "gima obiro e pache."

eng: “What scared me was China’s directive outlawing spitting. I dreaded what would happen in Kenya if SARS got here, considering that members of the Kalenjin community have a habit of spitting all over the place,” Maritim said.
luo: Maritim medo wacho kama, "Gima nomiya luoro en chik mane China ogolo makwero ng'udho olap. Naluor ahinya kane aparo gima biro timore ka SARS ochopo Kenya, nikech thoth Jo-Kalenjin nigi tim mar ng'udho olaw kamoro amora."

eng: Though the song got considerable airtime, Maritim says he is surprised by the renewed interest in the song in the face of Covid-19.
luo: Kata obedo ni e kinde ma ne ogol werno thoth ji ne owinje e redio, Maritim wacho ni owuoro ahinya ni ji odok e winjo werno nikech Covid-19.

eng: The singer blasted Kenyans for disregarding the government directives on containment of Covid-19.
luo: Jawerno ne noseyo Jo-Kenya ma tamore luwo chike ma sirkal chiwo mondo ogeng' landruok mar Covid-19.

eng: “The world managed to beat SARS and Ebola by adhering to prescribed safety measures. Here, we are just dancing with death,” he said.
luo: Nowacho kama, "SARS kod Ebola ne orumo nikech ji noluwo chike ma ne oketnegi. Wan watugo gi tho."

eng: When asked whether he was living up to his own message of staying safe as per his message in the song, he said: “My brother, have you spotted me in the streets lately? I have confined myself to my house as a matter of fact.”
luo: Ka ne openje ka be oluwo paro ma ne ochiwo e wer mane owero, nowacho kama, "Osiepa, be iseroma koda kawuotho oko machiegnini? Alorora e oda."

eng: Maritim argued that according to him there is no difference between SARS and Covid-19.
luo: Maritim wacho ni en oneno ni onge pogruok e kind SARS kod Covid-19.

eng: “It is the same disease, just diffident names. You just look at the symptoms and the origins and it’s the same thing.
luo: Owacho niya, "En tuo achiel, nying ema opogore. Tem ane rango ranyisi mag tuogo kod kaka ne gichakore, ibiro yudo ni gin gimoro achiel.

eng: “During SARS people were advised to practice social distancing and those infected were quarantined.
luo: E kinde tuo mar SARS, ne onyis ji mondo kik gibed machiegni gi jowetegi to jotuo ne iketo tenge.

eng: “We were also told to wash our hands and cover our mouths while coughing. Aren’t we now being told the same things?” he said.
luo: Ne onyiswa bende mondo walog lwetewa kendo waum dhowa sama wafwolo. Donge mago e gik mwatimo sani?

eng: The only difference he said is that people are now being asked to wear gloves for protection.
luo: Pogruok mantie en ni sani ji umo nyaka lwetegi."

eng: Maritim said since Covid-19 knocked the dust off his song, someone who was listening to it for the first time accused him of “bringing” the disease to Kenya.
luo: Maritim nowacho nikech Covid-19 ne omiye wende ong'ere kendo, ng'at moro ma yande kowinjo wendno mokwongo ne owacho ni en ema "okelo" tuono Kenya.

eng: “I did not ‘call’ the disease. I have never travelled to China. I just did a song to educate them to practice social distancing whenever the world is ravaged by a disease whose cure is not known,” he said, and called on Kenyans to heed the government’s directive on social distancing.
luo: Nojiwo ji mondo oluw chike mar sirkal oketo kendo nowacho niya, "Ne ok akelo tuono. Pok adhiga kata China. Nawero wendno mondo ojiw ji obed mabor gi jowetegi sama tuo moro omuoch e piny ma yadhe ok ong'ere."

eng: “If the government directs that there should be no handshaking, why should we defy such a simple order? Can’t we just salute like military officers and everyone goes his or her way. Why do we want to kill each other with foolishness?” he posed.
luo: Nopenjo kama: "Ka sirkal owacho ni ji kik mosre, ang'o momiyo watamore luwo gima yot kamano? Donge wanyalo mana goyo salut kaka askeche timoga kae to wadhi kama wadhiye? Ang'o momiyo wadwaro nego jowetewa nikech fupwa?"

eng: The mark of a great book is often its ability to provoke robust debates and force readers to confront uncomfortable content.
luo: Buk maber ing'eyo gi kaka ji wuoyo e weche manie bugno kendo chuno jasomo mondo osome kata ka ok odwar.

eng: Kenyan, Christian, Queer by the academic Adriaan Van Klinken provides a way to imagine a future continent where members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and intersex (LGBTI) community can exercise their rights to dignity, voice, agency, space and health without fear of stigma, harassment and worse.
luo: Buk milungo ni Kenyan, Christian, Queer mondik gi Adriaan Van Klinken wuoyo e wi ndalo ma piny biro pong' gi mon makendo jowetegi, kod chwo makendore gi chwo wetegi  to ji yanygi kata kwedogi kendo gin gi ratiro mar chiwo pachgi, timo ohala kod yudo thieth ma ok obuon-gi.

eng: The author is a leading voice in LGBTI studies, with a special focus on the role of religion, in particular African Christianity.
luo: Jandikono ong'ere ahinya e kedo ne ratiro kod somo mag LGBTI, ka onono ahinya ahinya migawo ma din omako e wechego, to ahinya din mar Jokristo ma Afrika.

eng: In Kenyan, Christian, Queer he presents an ethnographic study of the Kenyan queer community, one that is creating space for its own church and queer theology in a homophobic social, religious and political environment.
